Then I had problemswith the keyboard function. Talked to support and I had to reset it. Then I had problems with the date/time. Had to reset it.Then I had a problem with Silk working properly. Talked to support and they could not resolve the problem.From my experiences when you get something "new" and immediately have several problems with ityou're probably going to have other problems too. So I decided to return it. I don't know for sure if thiswas "new" or "refurbished". I bought it as new. I will give 5 stars to Amazon's return process. That seemedto work fine. Now I don't know what to do. The 8.9" at $189 is a really good deal. I don't want to go through thisagain though. I have had the Fire HD 7" for awhile and have never had a problem.While I was on the phone with support the Kindle reset and did an upgrade on it's own. That'swhy I don't think this was a new unit.
Reviews.Title: Very Disapointed

Reviews.Author: Dicran Hanessian
Reviews.Content: don't buy refurbished. I bought this refurbished and was never able to connect to the wifi I tried on several ways and diferent places (wifi) .and for the price they charge is better spend $20.00 more and buy new.
Reviews.Title: don't recommend to buy refurbished

Reviews.Author: Vicki Cheney
Reviews.Content: I probably would have given it 5 stars a while ago.  Now that it is almost a year old I find it freezing, stopping, ignoring my touches on the screen and being slower than molasses.  I have a decent wireless network and other devices work just fine.  I have claered the browser cached and turned the device off completely to try to resolve the issues. I rate it 4 stars because I like the concept and the display is good.  The sound could be a bit louder for these old ears but I don't use it for video often or for music.  I find I have to put my head pretty close to the speakers when I do want to hear something.  And, of course, I like it because of the content available.I will be calling Amazon support today about the device because of the issues I am having with it, before the one year is up.I am still an Amazon device fan and spend a lot of time on my Kindle Keyboard. I don't want to switch to another device because, I hate to say it, short of the Apple devices, they all have problems, from what I hear.  But having one Kindle ereader give out in less than a year, Kindle Fire first generation devices having to be replaced because of charging dock issues, and the current problems with the Kindle Fire HD, I am not sure I want to spend nearly $400 on the new HDX version.  Longevity seems to be an issue with these devices.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9" review after almost one year of ownership.

Reviews.Author: Book Collector
Reviews.Content: I'd love this tablet/reader even if the price were the same as an iPad 2, but the fact that it now costs $170 less makes it a no-brainer for me.  The screen is gorgeous to look at and very responsive (I hate twitchy touchscreens).  I've had no problems with freezing or with charging, and the battery has been holding a charge very well.  If you are looking to save money while still getting the HD experience, in my opinion this bigger model is a better value than the "new" small Kindle Fire HD, which, while inexpensive, has had some features like the camera stripped out.  And while the new HDX looks great, I don't need to spend that much money to satisfy my reading/surfing/videos/email/social media habits.I don't find the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 heavy, but then I don't expect to be able to hold an 8.9 inch tablet in one hand and not propped up for a long period of time. (I still carry only my smaller Kindle in my handbag, though; the bigger model tends to stay at home, but that's because of size, not weight.)Amazon Prime makes this model perfect for my family, because streaming movies and TV episodes is so easy. I love being able to set up separate profiles for my teenagers, too.  When it comes to online content, books and movies, sometimes teens need even more supervision than younger kids. ;)
Reviews.Title: Fantastic value, great tablet

Reviews.Author: Mike H.
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I was able to get tablet at such a great price. Amazon you amaze me. Though this is refurbished, it looks, feels and acts brand new. You would have no idea that it was refurbished!!!. Variety of apps are limited in the Amazon App store but I gave this 5 stars because you CAN NOT find anything out there that compares in terms of features, the quality video/audio speed of operations system AND price. Blew my mind!!
Reviews.Title: I feel guilty!!!!

Reviews.Author: Adam Rembisz
Reviews.Content: The pros of the Kindle HD are simply video, such as Netflix you are guaranteed an awesome picture quality for movies.The reading is okay but strains your eyes after a while plus the unit is too heavy to use as an everyday reader.The sound quality is okay but only if you are in a quiet room, just doesn't put out the sound loud enough to use while cooking or if there is any background noise.The internet browser is terrible and very slow.  Definitely not good for internet use at all takes forever to switch pages or upload a new page.  Bottom line is that the unit comes at a good price but just doesn't deliver what Amazon brags about.
Reviews.Title: I would not buy the Kindle HD again.....

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I just got my new Kindle HD 8.9.  I wanted the bigger display.  I already owned the Kindle HD 7", Paperwhite and Kindle Keyboard.  I love it!  The display is lovely and crisp!  I have been watching Shark week with Amazon Streaming and it is beautiful.  The only issue that I see different is that the battery does not stay charged nearly as long as the Kindle HD 7". I did what was expected when I first got it in, I charged for 24 hours. I did research on this and was told that this is the thing to do.  In any case, I love it, and I love the Kindle case that I bought also, the Persimmon Amazon version.  I would recommend this product 100%.  I should have just paid the extra money for the large display to begin with.
Reviews.Title: What's not to love?

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift already had a kindle reader and the fire and was really wanting the H/D when they came out it has meet all my expectations and then some I love the amazing video quality when watching movies and the x-ray ability is really cool. I really like the Immersion reading I've been a member of audible for a long time and the pairing of the kindle books and audible professional readers is a prefect match. The kindle H/D is a great tablet
Reviews.Title: LOVE THE H/D 8.9

Reviews.Author: k davis
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle because it is light to handle. The screen is a nice size which makes it easy to read my books. There are so many features on the kindle and I am still learning how to do everything. The Kindle is easy to carry around. I Love it. I would recommend it to anyone I know.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: Karen Erlanson
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire HD! I have an older read-only Kindle and I liked my husband's iPad, so I looked at upgrading to the Kindle Fire HD 8.9", and I'm so glad I did! I play the same games as I did on the iPad, and the picture quality is crystal clear. I love the different light settings to read my books, no need for a separate light anymore. And it is much easier to pick the book I want to read; also all my books on my older Kindle automatically transferred to the new one. I still do Facebook and browse the web, etc., just like on the iPad. And with the lower price of $269, I feel I got a bargain!
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"

Reviews.Author: k brearley
Reviews.Content: I REALLY like Kindle Fire but I have had some problems with charging my table.I had a second generation Kindle for a long time and REALLY loved it.I never had a problem charging my first Kindle but the fire does not seem to connect unless I plug it in and then unplug and replying it.I contacted c Ted Kindle support I was not very happy with the support I was given.I was told a replacement would be sent to me but was told they could not guarantee it would be new. I had just bought my Kindle and that did nit sit well with me. I spoke with someone who said he would try to make sure I got a new one.He left me a message on my machine that was not clear and never heard back.I like my product but will not buy another amazon product because of the way I have been treated.
Reviews.Title: Happy but some problems

Reviews.Author: RSMH
Reviews.Content: As an IT Professional I have not been one that has get too involved in having to have the latest and greatest in today's technology. It was seeking the next line of book(s) from one of my favorite authors that had me purchase a Kindle, because the likes of 'hardcover' was dwindling down faster than 'paperback'. In discussing the purchase with my wife she too had contemplated getting one so I purchased two at the same time. She has enjoying hers, using the wireless connection to review all that Amazon has to offer for the device. But unfortunately the other unit has had a problem in connecting to wireless networks since the very first day. Having tried every trick listed and those of my own as an IT Professional, there comes a time when you have to surrender and replace the unit. There is where things have become a little uncomfortable, as I have spent 'good money' on these devices but am not getting very much communication from Amazon in trying to rectify/replace my problemed Kindle. My last attempt was via email, where it said I would hear something in a timeframe that has been more than surpassed. It is as simple as me wanting to get this resolved inside of the 'one week' that I have had the unit.
Reviews.Title: A Nice Gadget

Reviews.Author: mini_hakr "mini_hakr"
Reviews.Content: I was an early adopter of the original Fire - which I liked, but ... so so. It had some design problems IMO like the protruding power button which was easy to press while in use, etc. That being said - I ended up using it much more than my (original) 32GB WiFi/3G iPad. The iPad however was useful on-the-go (because of the 3G).I decided to wait on the Fire HD this time, and after the price drop, decided to pick up the 64GB/4G LTE version (without ads). I don't know why you would spend $500 to still get ads on your lockscreen ... but I digress ...The picture quality is awesome, as is the sound. The overall build quality and design is markedly better than the Fire - it 'feels' good in your hands, I like the location of the power and volume buttons. As I had the predecessor, the Fire HD UI is pretty seamless and straight forward. Overall, its a very good device - especially for video playback.The 4G LTE option with $50 250MB option was the feature which pushed me over. I only rarely need on-the-go web access, as free WiFi seems about everywhere now, but when I do need it, its good to have.I never had trouble with WiFi before on the Fire, so I can't say the Fire HD is faster or better (?). I guess I could run some internet benchmark tool like speednet ... but WiFi service in my neighborhood has as much to do with microwave oven and cordless phone use (as well as activity among the some 20 APs I can see in my house) than anything else.I was surprised about not having a charger in the box.The ATT service setup is not without some hitches ... if you are an existing ATT customer, you can't (apparently?) take advantage of the special $50/250MB mo promotional offer (its based on email address). After sign up and activation of the account, I had to power cycle the device to really activate the 4G service. 4G in Hillsboro, OR overall seems hit-or-miss coverage-wise, and the device doesn't seem to handle downgrading to a lower-speed option well/at all.I am somewhat surprised at the battery-life of the device. Connected standby/idle states seem 'good' - it holds a charge for days. However, with web-browsing use, the battery drops faster than expected (e.g. down to 80% from full-charge within ~1+ hour?) I'm still trying to find a 'battery use' panel similar to what I have on my Google Nexus ... to see if it is some background app to blame ...And lastly, the on-screen keyboard seems a bit more twitchy than the old Fire keyboard - for whatever reason, its harder to type on the Fire HD (?).8-April-13 UpdateUsing my Samsung/Google Nexus USB charger to charge up this device is glacial ... it doesn't charge to 100% overnight. You should seriously consider the Kindle HD charger for this device.I downloaded a few games to the device e.g. "Asphalt Heat 7", and "Modern Combat 4" - the gaming graphics performance is honestly awesome for a tablet and totally unexpected (game load times are slow though). That being said - goodbye to battery life.Overall, at a family get-together they were asking "Is that the latest iPad?". Amazon's latest kindle fire HD is really impressive.
Reviews.Title: Excellent multimedia product

Reviews.Author: Texas Rose "Roseanna"
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Kindle, and I love it. It is a little bigger, therefore heavier, than others, but for my purposes, it is great. The only thing that I have found that I don't like it that when I download videos or TV shows and save to this Kindle, then I cannot watch them offline like on the original Kindle Fire. On this Kindle HD, I have to ALWAYS be connected to wireless to watch movies, videos, or TV while on the original Kindle Fire, once something was downloaded, I could watch it offline. This is a slight bother when I am somewhere that has no wireless, but this is becoming less and less a problem since so many people and places have HUBs or free wireless spots.The sound quality and larger screen for visual quality is excellent. I love that it has a built in camera and I have used it for Skype, taking photos, and taking videos. Excellent! I can already tell that I'm going to have to get another one because my husband keeps borrowing mine.
Reviews.Title: Excellent

Reviews.Author: PT Cruiser
Reviews.Content: I wondered how much better this new Kindle would be than the original Kindle Fire which we use everyday and love. (I purchased the one with 32 GB and no ads.) The 8.9 doesn't look all that much bigger in the pictures on the webpage of the two next to each other, but when I see them together here, there really is quite a difference. I can finally read magazines on my Kindle without having to scroll back and forth to see the whole page and it actually seems more like reading a paper magazine. I didn't subscribe to any magazines on the smaller one, but I will now. It will be so nice not to have magazines piling up and having to recycle them. It's great for reading books as well. And the high definition screen really makes quite a difference. I thought the old one was plenty sharp, but there was a noticeable difference as soon as I turned it on.This is the first Kindle I've owned that has Bluetooth. I buy all my music from Amazon these days and I have lots of playlists so it's really nice to be able to stream them from the cloud and connect to a portable speaker such as this: Satechi BT Touch Wireless Portable Bluetooth Hands-free Speaker System for iPhone / Android Smart Phones / iPad / Tablets / Macbook / Notebooks. Pairing is simple, just like connecting to our home wifi network was. It recognized the network right away, asked for a password, and connected right up. All of my Kindle content from my other Kindles showed up and was available for download. The wifi speed seems faster than my older Kindle.Another thing that is different on this Kindle is that the speakers are on the back. I'm not sure that I like that. It can be a bit of a problem when you use a cover such as this one: Verso "Profile" Standing Cover for Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Black (will only fit Kindle Fire HD 8.9") that covers the back. I can still hear it pretty well, but it sounds a bit muffled. The sound is stereo and sounds decent with the cover off. I often listen with headphones anyway and there is a port on the top to plug them in.Movies are beautiful with the high definition bigger screen. And there are more movies every day with Amazon Instant Video. And with an Amazon Prime account there are a lot of them as well as TV shows that are free to watch. The battery life is long enough that you can watch a couple of movies before recharging. Youtube is more fun to watch on this model also.I'm very happy with this new Kindle and love all the improvements. We'll still use the 7 inch original Fire as well as the 2nd generation Kindle with keyboard. Those two are easy to carry along with traveling and fit into a purse whereas this one is too big. And I like the Whispernet on the older one because I can use it to connect to purchase newspapers or books when I'm not in an area with wifi.
Reviews.Title: Delighted with this new Kindle

Reviews.Author: Daniel Newsome "supervelous"
Reviews.Content: OK, before I go into my thoughts on the product, I will state my experience with tablets and smartphones in general.  I am a huge Apple fan, or have been in the past.  I have owned every iphone since the 3G, owned an Ipad 3 (first retina ipad) for 30 days before returning it, for reasons I will explain shortly.  I also have an Ipad in the home, as my live-in girlfriend has the Ipad 3rd generation with retina display.  I also owned the Original Kindle Fire which I won in a contest at work.On to the reasoning on why I have never personally owned an Ipad for longer than 30 days, which is important because this product is not for everyone.First, let me say I believe the Ipad is the best tablet on the market.  Meaning, if someone came up to me, with every tablet on the market, and said pick one for free, I would choose the Ipad with no hesitation.  However, like most people, money is a consideration.  If money is no issue to you, buy an Ipad.  It has the 2nd best screen (behind the Android Nexus 10), the most fluid/elegant user interface, the best app ecosystem, and a premium build.  Also, Apple is a great company with outstanding customer service (and physical retail locations), there are a wide variety of accessories available, and it will integrate seamlessly with your other apple products (like my iphone).  Apple products just work, they're nice to look at, and they maintain a high resale value.That said, money is an issue for me, specifically value, or bang for my buck.  My tablet needs boil down to only those things which are inconvenient/difficult to do on my smartphone (which I always have with me) or my laptop (which is for WORK/productivity).  Specifically, reading books, watching video, and surfing the web.  Those are the BIG 3 for me!  I don't have any desire to play games (I can do that on my phone, but mainly I enjoy console gaming).  I don't care that much about apps other than the major ones which are usually on all app ecosystems.  The only apps I care about are those that deal with one of those big 3 of reading, watching, and surfing - where the screen size of a tablet is much preferred over that of a phone.  However, I didn't want to pay $500+ for just those 3 things!Out of the box, the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 does 2 of those 3 things as good as an Ipad.  Reading and Watching video are at least as good on the Fire as the iPad.  The one area it's lacking is web surfing, as Silk consistently (in my experience) slows down, stutters and sometimes crashes. This has been my experience with Silk on 2 separate Fire 8.9's (I got a replacement due to a scratch in my original screen).  This was almost enough to make me want to return it, BUT with a little research you can download an alternate browser such as Google Chrome or Dolphin which make the web surfing experience about on par with an Ipad, and with Flash!Another Huge bonus is Kindle Freetime Unlimited.  Anyone with a young child will appreciate this.  I want to allow my child to use my tablet, but I don't want her to have complete freedom to surf the web and have access to my apps, books, music, etc.  Kindle Freetime allows an entirely separate "area" for your children, where you set the parameters of what you want them to be able to access!  This is a wonderful feature!There are two other nice advantages this tablet has over the iPad:  Comfort and Sound.  This tablet is more comfortable to hold than an iPad.  It's lighter & has rounded softer edges as opposed to the sharp metallic edges on an Ipad..  This is HUGE, especially to someone like me who likes to use it in bed, or hold it for long periods of time while reading a book, watching a movie, etc.  The sound is not great, but it's very very good for a tablet.  It is louder than an ipad and has stereo speakers (Ipad is mono).Who would I not recommend this to?  Like I said earlier, if money is no object, you may opt for an iPad.  If style/looks/build, quality/quantity of apps, and the fluidity/elegance of the user interface are at the top of your list, an iPad may suit you better.  Everything works/moves/flows so well on an Ipad, the menus are elegant, everything is intuitive.  There are more apps, and many of the apps available on both Ipad and Kindle are of a higher quality on the Ipad.My Girlfriend cares about how her gadgets look, loves playing games and discovering new apps, and loves the fluidity, intuitiveness, and elegance of the ipad interface.  For her Ipad is the answer.For ME and my needs, the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is the best value on the market.  I got it for $249 (half the price of an Ipad!) and it does the things I care about just as well as an Ipad, with some added bonuses!  Highly recommend if your tablet needs are anything like mine!
Reviews.Title: Best VALUE Tablet on the market!

Reviews.Author: SingingDesigner
Reviews.Content: Cons:1) The battery takes an unusually long time to charge when on or in Sleep Mode (less time when the Kindle is shut down) and seems to drain fast even when doing even something as simple as reading.2) I hate the button placement on the sides. The volume buttons are hard to find and use, and occasionally, I've accidentally hit the power button when holding the sides to play games.3) The user interface is not the most responsive, and rather tricky to navigate. For example, the touch screen is not as intuitive and has, at times, required repeated attempts on my part. This is not a consistent problem, however.4) No Flash. Now I know this has been mentioned on Amazon's Kindle info page, but it's not made very clear. This is a big deal to me as there are flash video files that I like to watch. I was forced to install the Dolphin browser, which is slower than Silk, and then add Flash (all of this required a file manager installation as well) and, after all that, the files crash during playback. I can't tell whether this is the fault of the Kindle or Dolphin, but it's a big loss.5) The Kindle has frozen or crashed on a couple of occasions, usually while playing games.  Overall, it's not been a consistent problem, however.6) As others have mentioned, you will feel the limitations of available apps frustrating at times.7) Not as satisfying if you're not a Prime MemberPros:1) The speed is noticeably fast, and the HD graphics overall works great.2) Video from Amazon and other apps (not using Flash, of course) plays like a dream. I've been checking out "West Wing" from Amazon Instant Video and I've not had any issues.3) Lots of great cheap/free reading, especially the classics. And as a reader, it works well.Sum:This is my first tablet, and I had to decide what I wanted one for, and whether it was worth paying 2x the price for the Apple iPad, as price was a factor (I bought this product for $250).  As my needs were mostly recreational (games, video, music, reading, some surfing) I'm satisfied with the Kindle Fire 8.9.
Reviews.Title: Complaints about the battery life, usability design, no Flash, and app limitations, but still pleased overall

Reviews.Author: C. Gregory "C. Gregory"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 32gb version of tghe 8.9 without special offers.I am grateful amazon listens to customer feedback. While the Kindle fire was great (wth a few annoying issues) but I ended up selling it. mainly because I wanted  something bigger. and whle the kindle fire hd is pretty much the ame equipment as the 8.9 except for the larger screen, there are a few major differences. One is blutooth. I never understood why the orginal kindle fire did not have this feature. I didn't watch movies on my old one bcause I'd have to listen through corded headphones. If you are out and about, say at a train station or airport you want felxibility. This one has that. but you can buy a kickstand case and then listen to movie with a blutooth headset. I really wanted that feature on my old one, but amazon didn't just upgrade this device incrementally, they basically started from the beginning. You get blutooth and a forward facing camera along with book features like xray. The only negative thing is my covers do not show up on the carousel (it's hit or miss for the actual books I have) However they show up in the book section. I used calibre to side load books bought previously or belonged to other readers.I id try out the Nook tablet and I was greatly disappinted (Ihaven't seen or worked with their hd version. That was based on the color/touch screen version. That one didn't hang around long, but about that time i heard of the kindle fire HD coming out. and me being the nerd that I am had to get the one with more storage and blutooth features (I have a $90 set of headphones so combined with the the Kindle fire hd itself, it all works out great. The video quality is great and I was really impressed by the sound out of the speakers The stereo speakers was a great touch.I have never owned any other tablets except for nook and fire, so I can't say much about the ipad though I've played with one before. pretty much I have seen/touched most of the tablets and the fire is not only affordable (well compared to what you are getting) and has everything I need right now.I am really impressed by this reader. So there isn't much need to go for the bigger/more expensive tablets. Besides some actually act more like a laptop so if you want something with a good size screen that's more portable then this is the way to go. While my device has no adds under the carousel if you are to highlight something (let's just say an app)then it shows "recommended for you" and while this is a petty gripe I think since i didn't pay for the adds, then I shouldn't be getting those either.But overall it's a great device looks/sounds wonderful.and with the 8.9 screen you get more breathing room and a better showcase for your movies etc. This one does come with a a sync cable which the orginal fire didn't. There is no wall charger by the way. But amazon probably has one for  a good price. Right now I don't need it though.  So that's fine with me at least for now.  It's pretty easy to learn, and also if you buy certain marked cds through amazon marketplace they will rip it to the cloud for you (another great service) And it doesn't count towards your alloted storage limit. so that way if you are connected  t wi-fi you can listen to your online collection which is a definite plus.there isn't much left to say really. There are way more positives than negatives.  about this device and even the worst of it is mild in comparison with any isues I had with the nook.So pick one up today.
Reviews.Title: Finally, the moment has arrived...

Reviews.Author: Debra
Reviews.Content: I purchased my kindle fire over a year and a half ago, and it never left my side.  I loved it!  When the new Kindle Fire HD 8.9 came out I was totally excited.  I purchased it roughly about 3 weeks ago.  Best purchase made this year.  I love it.  I take it with me everywhere.  I can't say enough about the screen.  The colors are vibrant, the sound crystal clear.  My Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is in my purse and goes with me everywhere.  I have recommended it to friends, family and perfect strangers I meet.  Worth every penny for this wonderful tablet.  Enjoy... I am!Debbie S.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: Lady "J"
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband. He loves it. I have the iPad myself and can tell you there's not a big difference between the two (except the price). I gave the kindle 5 stars because I've been using my husband's kindle to see which is better and found it to be very compatible with the iPad. Although the kindle has just as many functions as the iPad I would still choose the iPad because I'm use to it and i love it. But, my husband, who was always on my iPad, said he would choose the kindle. To each its own. �
Reviews.Title: My husband loves it!

Reviews.Author: Laura's viewpoint
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this purchase!  I compared to the Ipad which everyone loves.  I couldn't justify the cost difference and in researching the kindle, it seemed to have everything I was looking for: exchange email capabilities for my business, web surfing (again I use this in my business allowing me to be VERY mobile), some games for fun (not a heavy gaming user, but I bet it works perfect for those who are), streaming movies etc.  I read a bunch of reviews and didn't find any issues that some others expressed (front facing camera not an issue for me, nor was the lack of an included power charger).  Set-up extremely user friendly and intuitive (without instruction booklet).  I got the 16GB Wi-fi version which again, fits my needs perfectly.  I have a Samsung Galaxy SIII which has a mobile hotspot, and use that when no wifi connection available.  The screen picture and sound are fantastic.  I also purchased the protective cover with magnectic close.  I love that I can open and close the Kindle without having to turn it on/off with this cover.  The stand up feature works great - no issues.  I bought the cover through Amazon, but it was probably a return, so I got it for less.  Again, all a great value!  Really can't think of anything that would improve my experience EXCEPT for a FABLET option - when is the phone going to be incorporated into the TABLET?
Reviews.Title: Extremely happy with Kindle fire HD 16MB 8.9' WIFI only

Reviews.Author: J. Allsup "Cows have hooves because they lact...
Reviews.Content: I've been rockin' a 1st gen kindle since they first came out.  I still have it.  It still works.  I love it.  Problem is I hate having to read by flashlight so I don't wake the Wifey.So, I bought this one.  I was going to go with the 7" but the Wifey said, "Might as well get the newest one."  She's usually right about everything and so I went with her suggestion.  She was right,  Of course.I unboxed this thing and Wallah! I was super psyched.  The thing runs flawlessly.  There were a pretty good amount of apps in the app store and I was even able to dim the brightness and make the book pages sepia, much easier on the eyes for me.Netflix literally zoomed 1080p hd and delivered impressive sound from the side/rear mounted speakers.  Very impressive.  Especially with our internet speed... I can't talk about that it makes me want to cry...I installed all the essential apps that I could find and there is where I hit my first snag.  There were a bunch off android apps that I really like to use that aren't available in the Amazon App Store.  So I looked around and there was a setting to allow 3rd party Apps but it doesn't really give you access to the great android apps or the apps on Google Play.  I don't know why they nerfed the OS like this but most likely it was to make more money. I'm hoping in the future they allow us more freedom to choose the apps we want from where we want them. C'est la vie.My second point of contention is the Mini HDMI port.  I have a couple devices that use the mini to large cables and they are both the same.  The port on the Kindle is tiny and weird and so I will have to fork out about 6 bucks for one which isn't a big deal, I just wish they would have let me know it was going to be proprietary so I could have ordered it at the same time.(It's a micro HDMI type D to HDMI Type A... just to save you the hassle of trying to figure it out.)Finally, the Kindle Quick Charger.  Another way to squeeze a couple bucks out of you.  Luckily I already had a wall socket usb quick charger so it's not a big deal.  However for those who don't happen to have one and opt out on the Kindle Quick Charger there is this caveat!((Dramatic pause of silence))It charges in under fourteen hours from your computers usb port.  Wait did that say 14 hours?  The battery life is 10 hours.  I may not have a doctorate in math but something just doesn't add up there.Still over all I give this 5 stars.  I got exactly what they promised and it was only my expectations that let me down, just a little.I love this Kindle and recommend it to anyone looking for a multi purposed e-reader.  Especially those, like me, have to save their pennies for a long time to get new and shiny things.  Ooh... Shiny.
Reviews.Title: Everything it claims to be.

Reviews.Author: mon2cents
Reviews.Content: When writing a tech review it is as simple as does the tech do what I expect it to do? The answer is YES.This is my 2nd kindle. The first was the KindleFire sold in USA November 2011.Both are good tablets. They each come with excellent customer support and a healthy customer knowledge base.Improvements: the AC adapter. The older adapter was beginning to fail on some first gen. KindleFire. Overtime the connection from cord to machine becomes fussy. The metal connector is small prone to dust, temp, etc. If one could not get the connector to properly sit within the KindleFire. The machine would not get charged.Now a two part charger is the norm (sold separately) it is similar to a dual ended wire. The small end goes to the kindle the large end goes to the AC wall plug.Considering the number of first gen KindleFire to lose ground because of traditional AC adapter. This is a welcome Improvement. Good that the AC adapter is sold separately as this keeps other companies competitive as well as keeps cost down of KindleFire.Lastly - do I read more because I have KindleFire? YesDo I watch shows with my family more often? YesDo I listen to new artists and rediscover old faves? YesDo we all play more social games? YesIt's been fun and informative to be a KindleFire customer.. past... present... future.
Reviews.Title: Best Overall Improvement

Reviews.Author: dweb
Reviews.Content: So I was searching for e-readers/tablets so I could easily take books on trips with me.  This was a big step as I love the feel of a paperback in my hands.  Being a Mac family I of course was looking at an iPad, but those are just way too pricey.So I did some research and settled after a lot of debating on the Kindle 8.9".  In my opinion it easily beats out the comparable Nook just for the sheer fact you can hook up your Prime account.  I have watched enough MST3K in the month I have had it to make the purchase alone worth it.I am also sticking with the ads because it reminds me of some of the Kindle daily deals that are available so I don't forget to grab something I want.  If you are worried about the ads getting in the way, don't.  They are only on the lock screen and sometimes in a bottom corner.  This is not like the ads we are used to seeing as banners at the bottom of apps, the Kindle ads are unobtrusive and sometimes informative.Overall I will say if you are debating between this, the Nook HD and the iPad.  Do yourself a favor, get the Kindle and a Prime account.
Reviews.Title: Best "tablet" for the price

Reviews.Author: Rosebud "kywoman"
Reviews.Content: I really like the larger Kindle for watching movies, tv shows and reading my magazines.  This is my 3rd Kindle Fire and find that it is as good as the ipads on the market...this is the best product for the price.  The ipad doesn't really have anymore options than the Fire except the camera and I don't really use that feature, so at $299 for Fire versus $499 for the ipad, I am really happy with my purchase.
Reviews.Title: Large Fire

Reviews.Author: Barry Puckett
Reviews.Content: Overall the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is a great device considering the performance and quality of the hardware and software.  Several people have mentioned the lack of applications, however I have not found this to be an issue at all simply because I do not play games on the Kindle.  The video playback is great with excellent sound quality.  Email setup is a breeze and works great.  Ebook reading experience is great.  I also have an iPad and while the iPad does have it's advantages the Kindle is also great.  I especially like the physical size of the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" in comparison to the iPad.Would I buy it again? yes absolutelyHow does it compare to the iPad? very close, iPad's overall performance is better but the Kindle does not have any issuesWhat would I change? improve on the Amazon Silk browser.  I side loaded Google Chrome, which is what I use most all the time.
Reviews.Title: Great Tablet

Reviews.Author: G. Hansen
Reviews.Content: I bought this when it was on sale just before Christmas ($249). I wanted something that I could use to take notes in class, and use for textbooks. I also bought the otterbox defender for the Kindle. When the box showed up with both items the Kindle went straight into the Otterbox. Initially I had trouble using a stylus with the Otterbox, but that has resolved itself. There are several note taking apps that downloaded, and I'm still working out which one I like best. But, this is for the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 so here goes:The Kindle itself:WOW! The graphics are amazing. I've seen other tablets around campus, and this one is by far the best looking. Not by a little, I mean noticeably better.I bought the non-4G version with special offers. I have access to wireless anywhere on campus, at home etc so I don't need 4G. YMMV. Regarding the special offers: I don't find them annoying or intrusive in any way. Matter of fact, I've found that the more I use it the better Amazon is at predicting what may interest me. I went from just ignoring them on the start screen to actually glancing at them to see if it's something I want.The key is that if I'm not interested it takes less time to just continue on than it does to think about it. So, for me, it's not even worth the $15 extra to do away with the offers.The performance is good. I have had a few times that it's been slow when doing something on the net, but that's a function of the campus network. Whenever I have full wireless service bars it's just plain fast.Movies....What can I say, they work well, and the picture is outstanding and the sound is great.  I haven't used the HDMI out, so I can't comment on that.Books: Nothing short of excellent. Easy to see, easy to customize the view, easy to purchase.Websurfing: Not the best, mostly due to Silk (the native browser). It works, mostly well. The biggest problem I have is with drop-down menus on the web. Silk is not good at that. Oh and it won't do Flash player either. Searching the web there is a way to do it, but not using Silk. When I get around to downloading another browser I'll update this.The biggest negative that I've run into so far is that I have a hard time keeping it. The wife and kids seem to think it's great for playing games. Don't they know this is a serious tool?! Actually, the wife has decided that if I don't give her this one then she's buying one for herself.There are plenty of options now for tablets, and this market section is growing exponentially so by this time next year I expect this will be out of date. Will this/Amazon allow an update to Jelly Bean? I dunno, but from what I've heard it's possible. In the meantime, I'm plumb happy with my Kindle!
Reviews.Title: I'm using it for college classes..It's Great!!

Reviews.Author: Synieth
Reviews.Content: I got this item about a month ago, but I wanted to really use it for a while before reviewing it.First, my reasons for purchasing this: I already had a regular kindle and I used it for reading regularly. I've almost stopped buying paperback books completely. I finally felt it was time to upgrade. There were a few things I specifically wanted in a tablet.  I wanted apps such as netflix, and gmail, facebook, youtube, etc. I wanted to be able to read my kindle books, and watch my prime videos on amazon. Because my tablet is primarily for entertainment purposes getting the kindle was a no-brainer. I did some research on other tablets that had more customization and more options, but finally settled on the kindle because it does everything I want for a much better price.  Knowing that bias, now on to my review:VIDEOS:This device is amazing for videos. Especially ones that run in HD are exceptional. The screen is crystal clear and almost perfect. I say almost because there is so glare especially in bright light. For me, I do most of my movie/tv watching at night or in my dark bedroom with its heavy curtains, so this isn't usually a problem. But once or twice I have tried watching shows in the living room during the day, and if the sun is shining right in the windows, I can see more of my reflected face (especially in dark scenes) then I can of the movie. Again, this is only in almost direct sun. In softer light, or lower light, it isn't an issue, and even when it is you can usually find an angle that works. It is a small annoyance for me, but one that might be a bigger annoyance for someone who does a lot of video watching in bright light.READING:The screen for reading books is very bright, which I like. It can be turned down, or even switched to white on black. I have little problem reading even in bright sun. I am especially in love with how easy it is to highlight and make notes in the text.  I also have a copy of the OED on my kindle, so I can jump right to that from whatever book I am reading if I need a full definition of a word, which is amazing and has helped me out with some of my college classes. I've also tried reading some magazines and comic books which look amazing. DC comics recent reset some of their comics and I started reading the new Batman comics. The pages are pretty clear, and if you need to you can zoom in on panels to marvel at the artwork or read smaller writing. I might, when I can afford to, look into getting a magazine subscription like national geographic or something, just to see what that is like, but the few free ones I've tried look nice.APPS:My primary apps are Gmail, Facebook, Netflix, Skype, and Adobe Reader (for classes). These all work just fine on the kindle. I guess Youtube isn't available but there are ways to get it. I don't use it that often, and don't mind going to the website on the rare occasions I do, which works fine. Skype works pretty well, though it does get a little weird if you happen to adjust the kindle so the screen flips. It's just a small blip. Facebook, Gmail and Netflix all work perfectly, though I greatly prefer amazon videos to netflix, the amazon viewer just seems nicer and the videos look nicer.GAMES:I don't play a lot of games. I play words with friends now and then, but I did try out a couple of the more advanced graphic games such as the Sims game and Dungeon Hunter, both of which run without a problem and look amazing.SOUND:The sound on this thing is amazing. The case does change it a bit, but not drastically. I hardly use headphones with it because I most often use it alone at home. I don't even need it at full volume to hear it perfectly. It sounds as good as any TV.BATTERY:I had to go to the hospital when my sister was having her baby, and I spent all day, almost twelve hours, hanging out in the waiting room with nothing but my kindle. The battery held up well for just reading, but I didn't watch any videos because those do drain the battery quicker and I didn't want to run out. However, I can usually watch 3-4 hours of hd video before I get a notification to plug in my kindle. Which makes sense, things that use more power to run (videos, games) drain the battery faster than just reading.  It holds up well on tuesdays which are the days I spend almost all day on campus using it in class for web-searches or reading pdfs in the adobe app. I've never had it run out of battery when I need it, though I usually have to plug it in each night. It does take a long time to charge, even when plugged into the wall.OTHER THOUGHTS:Being less customizable than even a smart phone is a bit of a draw back. I wouldn't mind being able to set a background picture like I can on my android phone, for example. Or have a screen of apps like you can on most tablets.  While the carousel is convenient for getting to my things, I don't like that if I use something once it automatically goes to my carousel, like every time a view a webpage it is there at the front of my carousel and I have to remove it, because each new thing I try pushes the things I use most often back so I have to scroll over to it. Also, for some reason Facebook is constantly moving down to the end of the carousel even though I use it a lot. It gets shoved behind things I don't even use, which is weird. I'm always having to scroll over to find facebook.I purchased the $45 case that goes with this and don't regret it. I couldn't have lived without it. the kindle on its own without a case I fear too much for it getting broken or scratched. The case is amazing, I can stand it up and watch tv or read while I'm cooking or cleaning. and I feel safe putting it in my bag with my books and notebooks with the hard case. So I recommend it to anyone who gets the kindle, it is a bit expensive but it is a must-have.Also, a side-note about smudges. The screen smudges something awful. I've taken to carrying a cloth with me for cleaning the screen regularly. It is a must. But it really can't be helped.The kindle isn't perfect. But it is perfect for me. It does everything I need it to, and it does it beautifully. I can see it not being for everyone, especially someone who is looking for a tablet that can serve almost as a laptop replacement for the office. But if your primary use for it is watching/reading amazon content, social networking, emailing, and web browsing, than this is a great option at a great price and I would strongly recommend it.
Reviews.Title: Great Device

Reviews.Author: Marc aka Network XXIII
Reviews.Content: Well, its not that little since I went with the 8.9 inch instead of the 7 inch. I'm glad that I bought the larger version. More screen to move around, watch movies, and play games. Sound quality is superb. This is my first tablet/reader and found it very easy to learn and use. What is even better is that I can manage my content both on the device, in the Amazon Cloud, and on my computer via my account. Everything works together seamlessly. Makes you wish more things were made that way.
Reviews.Title: Say hello to my little friend

Reviews.Author: ahousel
Reviews.Content: I used to have a first generation iPad.  I will admit that I never used it much.  My son recently lost it, and I didn't want to spend the money to replace it.  I opted for the Kindle Fire HD.  It has everything I could want or need.  The resolution is awesome, and I love watching movies and shows using Amazon prime.  I am a big fan of Apple products, but I think the Kindle Fire is a much better value.
Reviews.Title: Everything I need.

Reviews.Author: E. S.
Reviews.Content: I have looked a Kindles for a couple of years and just couldn't make myself buy one. I just wasn't sure if I would use it. When my son came for a visit and brought his 7in fire hd I was sold after five minutes. I ordered the 8.9 shortly after he went home and have never regretted the purchase. My only problem was that my wife also loved it. Long story short I bought another 8.9 seven days later. It's very easy to operate and we are not very tech oriented (we still have flip phones) Reading is great on the 8.9 and there are a huge number of free books on amazon and through the public library. Any question about any kindle can be answered on the kindle help forum.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: E. C. Norton
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" has to be the biggest bargain in the Amazon universe, when compared to other tablets. It comes with so many pluses that it could take weeks to learn how to use it. If you are already buying books and music from Amazon, you have the added attraction of videos and movies, many free for Prime customers. It's a perfect gift for someone not skilled in computers, as all it takes to run it is a finger swipe. Yet Newbies will find the world of apps for sale by Amazon enough pleasure and entertainment to last for years. I'm glad I stepped up from my Kindle 3. Go for it!
Reviews.Title: FIRE STORM

Reviews.Author: Dave Clark
Reviews.Content: Haven't found much to complain about it.  Other than a limited modification for some programs and apps that don't work because its a Kindle vice a true Android OS system...its great.  My wife has cancer and during her chemo sessions I use it to read, play games and keep up with social network stuff while she gets her treatments.  Its easier than lugging a laptop and with space and power an issue, I haven't had any problems.  Very convenient.  Just wish they could make Flash work better.
Reviews.Title: Great product

Reviews.Author: April A Drury
Reviews.Content: After my first Kindle was stolen, I purchased An iPad mini because of all of the rave reviews. took me about 20 minutes to figure out that it was not for me.  Took it back the next day and promptly got on Amazon and ordered another Kindle. Best decision. Will probably never own an Apple product. The Kindle is so much more user friendly and easier on the wallet.
Reviews.Title: Prefer over Apple

Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire after a long debate over weather I wanted the IPad Mini or this Kindle. I am glad I chose the Kindle, I like the size of the 8.9, the movies on it are fantastic. The choice of books and movies are great . I only have WiFi and that is ok with me,, I don't need internet to read a good book!
Reviews.Title: Kindle For HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: DR-J-J
Reviews.Content: Ever since competition came out for the iPad, someone touted their tablet as an iPad killer.  Nonsense! The iPad is wonderful.  However, this 8.9 Kindle Fire HD is truly an iPad-killer! Why? It simply does more than the iPad allows and does it beautifully.  And it costs, one-half as much as the iPad.  It is better, lighter, faster, and more integrated. Very enjoyable.  Better than my iPad. I only carry the kindle fire HD now.
Reviews.Title: IPad-killer tablet that bodes well for Amazon

Reviews.Author: Dave Graham
Reviews.Content: I currently have a MacBook Air that I use for work & home, and an iPhone.  I have a MacMini at home connected to my TV for movies (Amazon Prime Video mostly), music, Hulu, etc.  My wife also has an Air & an iPhone, my oldest son has an Air & iPhone, and my two youngest have iPad 2's.  We are big users of the iCloud, particularly the calendar - it's the only way we keep things straight.  So, we are ***deep*** into the Apple ecosystem (cult?).  We also use Amazon quite a bit - goods, food, video, music, etc.  We're Amazon Prime members too.  And I use Google services all the time (maps, Drive, Google+, Reader, etc.), both for work and home.So when I started looking at tablets for myself - something I could use while I workout, go on trips with, etc. - all three ecosystems (Apple, Amazon, & Google) were 'on the table'.  I looked at the iPad Mini, the Nexus 7, and the Kindle HD 7.  There were things I liked & disliked for each.iPad Mini:  Pro: iCloud support for my calendar & contacts, can watch Amazon Prime Video, can access Apps written by Google  Con: kinda expensive, can't use the Kindle lending libraryGoogle Nexus 7:  Pro: can access Google Play Apps, nice price  Con: can't watch Amazon Prime video (without rooting?), can't use the Kindle lending library, can't access iCloudKindle Fire HD 7:  Pro: can watch Amazon Prime Video, can use the Kindle lending library, nice price  Con: can't access iCloud, can't access Google PlayNone were perfect, so I didn't buy any.  But my wonderful wife bought me the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 for Christmas (on that sale day that it was $249).  I've been playing with it daily for almost a month now, and I have to say I like it a lot.  It's got a great screen, nice sounding speakers, decent battery life, nice industrial design - it's nice to hold (though I do find it difficult to find the on/off button).  I use it in the following manner: - Amazon Video while I spin - Kindle lending library & Overdrive for reading books - Internet news (via Dolphin browser, which I prefer to Silk) - Google reader & Google+ via browser only (those Google Apps aren't available) - Words with friends - email, but just a little bit - at home only, not at workThere are some things it doesn't do well, like calendar (can't access iCloud), and the email program isn't great.  And it's frustrating to me that I can't access Google Play even though it's Android.  (I have used 1mobile.com to sideload some apps, like the Dolphin browser.)  But I knew those cons going into it.All in all, I'm glad to have it, it's a great interface to the Amazon ecosystem (which is both its strength & weakness).
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 from an Apple's guy view

Reviews.Author: Shannon Curran
Reviews.Content: I initially bought it for myself, but my husband is enjoying just as much as I am.  I have not downloaded any books yet.  I use it for the games and the internet mostly.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Author: ONE DAY AT A TIME
Reviews.Content: I've had a 2nd generation Kindle for 3 yrs. and with the boom of tablets now available I knew I wanted more than just an E-reader.  In comparing the top brands my choice was the Kindle Fire HD 8.9".  I had an Amazon gift card for $50, so I upgraded to 32 GB.  This was my Christmas present to me.  In the past three weeks i've been having a ball.  First off all the books from my old Kindle where added to the Kindle Fire HD.  Set up was so easy.  Leaning to use my new Kindle and all it's functions have not been difficult.  I have become a Prime member, so the Movies and TV shows that are availabable at no cost to me are wonderful.  With nothing on TV but reruns at this time, I've enjoyed several movies and whatched all of Downton Abby.  I set up my E-mail and Facebook accounts, even added a few games (had never played video games before) and downloaded music I like for $2.99 an album.  Books are my  # 1 with me, so it's great to see them all lined up by their covers on the Kindle Fire HD bookshelf.  I am far from a "Teck-Geek".  If you are able to do E-mail on your computer, operate a cell phone, and can read and follow directions, you can operate a Kindle Fire HD.
Reviews.Title: GREAT TABLET FOR RETIRED BEACH BUM!!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Richard K. Bruns
Reviews.Content: The kindle itself works great but, the app selection is VERY poor. I would of given the kindle 4 or even 5 stars if the app selection wasn't so misserable. I bought this primarily for my wife who wanted it for the books and it's great for that, so is sound. The product as a whole is awesome and works fantastic. had I known the app selection would of been so bad though, I probably would of bought a Google Nexxus tablet instead. But, with Amazon Prime, the books and movies will be a nice addition.
Reviews.Title: Great Kindle, poor app selection

Reviews.Author: carole gray
Reviews.Content: I like everything about it!!  light , easy to use,  . All I will ever need! very pleased!  Thank You!
Reviews.Title: It does everything i wanted, and More!:)

Reviews.Author: Joan Gooder
Reviews.Content: This newer version is so.... much nicer.  The speed is smootherl, the visual aspect is cleaner and clearer.  This truly makes reading books and viewing movies more enjoyable.  The web access is almost seamless.  Received item before the deadline time.  Support staff very friendly and professional.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Author: D. Kremer
Reviews.Content: Got Fifty dollars off and love this new Kindle. I own a smaller one but this one is so much better
Reviews.Title: Love my new Kindle.

Reviews.Author: Alan Golden
Reviews.Content: It is a perfect size and weight to carry on a plane and watch movies as well as read books
Reviews.Title: I love it

Reviews.Author: Joshua
Reviews.Content: I purchased my new kindle hd because I fell in love with the kindle fire.  I love to read but hate carrying around books as I travel.  Now I do not do that any more with my kindle.  I still have not used all of the features but the ones that I have are more than awesome to me.  This kindle like the others are so user friendly that anyone over 60 can use it without any issues.  I had asked if the HD would  have a camera and when I received the "YES" answer then  I was sold.  When it was time to pre-order.... I jumped on that wagon and put in my order and now i can skype my family and  look at movies and listen to my all time favorite music.  I am  in HOG HEAVEN....  I highly recommend this device.  Enjoy your time learning all about its many features.
Reviews.Title: kindle fire HD 32mg

Reviews.Author: matc mans wife
Reviews.Content: I previously had 7" Kindle E- Reader, which I loved so much that I upgraded to the Fire HD .  This is much bigger and does a lot more than the reader. The picture quality is amazing and it is very easy to use. I find myself watching TV shows on it. Sound quality is very good as well. The only complaint I have is that I spend too much time playing games!
Reviews.Title: Love it!!

Reviews.Author: Kimberly
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my husband for Christmas and let him have it early....he loves it will definitely buy another Kindle
Reviews.Title: Great present

Reviews.Author: Joe Pennington
Reviews.Content: I LOVE MY KINDLE! No I won't give it up ever! This is a awesome little computer and I wish I had bought one when they first came out instead of waiting.
Reviews.Title: Love it

Reviews.Author: Kim Hruby
Reviews.Content: I had been anxiously awaiting my Kindle. I wasn't disappointed. There is so much more to this than just being an e-reader!  I love it that it has audible capability while reading books. I also love the sound on this thing. It's like having surround sound. I love that you can access the web easily and I absolutely love the larger size. It is fantastic!
Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire HD 8.9!!!!

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: this is my 3rd kindle, 2nd fire. i am very happy with the 8.9, the sound is alot better than the 1st edition fire.  at 1st i was worried about the ads, but they are only on the start up screen (the one with the slide lock), worth saving the $15. i have been an amazon consumer for about 5 years now, and i will stay with them. the customer service i have received from them has always been great. and that is the reason i will stick with them in the future.
Reviews.Title: my 3rd series kindle

Reviews.Author: L. Rubin "Larry"
Reviews.Content: I have had my kindle HD 8.9 for about two weeks and delighted with the quality of the product given the its relatively modest cost.The kindle HD 8.9 excels as a media consumption device for kindle formatted books and audio books. I did have an issue with the audible website not recognizing the Kindle HD.  I was able to download the audio books from the kindle, but initiate the download from audible.com.  I'm not sure if anyone has had that problem, but it's not a big deal pulling the books down from the kindle.I was able to easily side load Maxthon as an alternative web browser to Amazon's silk browser.  I run several other androids app including New 360 and YouTube, and Netflix.  Netflix performs very well which is consistent with what other reviewers have reported.Rather than go with the $499 and ATT plan, it has made more sense to use my smart phone's Hotspot feature so I can browse the web when I don't have WIFI available.My advice to prospective buyers is to define your goals and make sure the kindle features line up with what you are trying to do.  Also, read the description of what you are getting so we don't get any more reviews complaining the charger is not thrown in and you the kindle doesn't support flash. Also, I can't see myself taking pictures with a tablet so personally back facing camera doesn't seem that important.Overall, a great purchase.
Reviews.Title: My Two Cents

Reviews.Author: lizbeth
Reviews.Content: I have only had it a week but it is becoming as easy to use an my regular Kindle. I am a reader and I like the double page format. It is like reading a hardcopy book. I'm glad I spent the extra to get the 8.9 screen.
Reviews.Title: First Tablet

Reviews.Author: Smart Shopper
Reviews.Content: I truly do love this tablet.  I have been a dedicated kindle reader since the first ereader ones came out several years ago.  I thought about buying a tablet but the cost of the apple was just too high, especially when you can buy a laptop for less.  Finally Amazon released the 8.9" tablet and I decided it was time.  You can't beat the price, the quality, or the functionality.  I have shown this to several of my friends who own the apple product and even they are impressed.  It is a great reader, web surfer, mp3 player, game player, and even movie player.  In the end it boils down to is if you are looking for a reasonably priced tablet that can do anything you want then you need to get a kindle fire.
Reviews.Title: This is a great tablet

Reviews.Author: Mimi
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle but my grandkids love it more.  I wish I could buy two, as the 2 boys are constantly fighting over who can play which games (which are free!).
Reviews.Title: Perfect

Reviews.Author: Kimberly
Reviews.Content: I got the 8.9inch 32G Kindle Fire HD  with wifi and its the best tablet available. The price is also fair for all that you get. The picture quality is top notch and  I can plug it into my Tv with an hdmi  reg to micro cord to get prime or netflix shows or movies with smooth streaming. I have had my regular kindle for over a year now and I still love it for reading because it is not backlit but I use my Fire for everything else. I would recommend it to everyone!
Reviews.Title: I love my kindle

Reviews.Author: jc
Reviews.Content: This was the best purchase that I made this year. The comparison chart with ipad was very helpful to me also helped me with decision to purchase. Easy to use and happy that no setup required. I had forgotten that no charger was included and will need to purchase asap.Love every detail about product and show everyone that have a desire to purchase a tablet my Kindle.
Reviews.Title: Wow

Reviews.Author: Christopher Walker
Reviews.Content: I am now using my Kindle Fire way more than my IPad 3. I find since I am a prime member I get more from it than my ipad and the screen quality is not that much different and the sound is better. I how ever feel the back is a bit slippery.
Reviews.Title: great device

Reviews.Author: Jay O
Reviews.Content: I've been a long time customer so I THOUGHT the HD kindle would be a good investment.  It wasn't.  Not only is their market extremely compared to any normal android device, but they completely block google play store and google related apps.  it doesn't sound like a bad thing until you realize that you can't use google maps or any of the other google aps you may be familiar with.  If you want any app released in the past 4 years don't buy a kindle HD
Reviews.Title: Worst product I've ever bought through amazon

Reviews.Author: Silvan Johnson
Reviews.Content: I like the Kindle Fire HD.  I've only owned one other tablet and compared to that, this has a much better resolution to the screen.  It serves my purpose (reading, streaming radio,some net surfing, FB) and is easy to use, but I find it doesn't hold a charge very long and takes quite a while to fully charge.  There are plenty of apps for free or low cost that I've taken advantage of.  The "Special Offers" are basically ads that appear when I first turn on the tablet....once I've unlocked it and start whatever I'm doing, they disappear, making that well worth the discount to the overall price.  I would recommend this tablet
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: Gail
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Kindle Fire for over a year and love it. When the Kindle 8.9" went on sale for Valentines Day I decided to get one. Well it's much slower to refresh the screen. When I run a weather app to see the radar the picture jumps. It's no where near smooth. Also I was playing music and trying to search the internet and it shut the music off. Guess it couldn't keep up or something. I am very disappointed in the 8.9" Kindle.
Reviews.Title: Slow refresh

Reviews.Author: Eric C. Byron "wildmedic"
Reviews.Content: I sort of wish I kept my old kindle. The silk web browser freezes up every other use. The kindle itself freezes up every so many uses. I was trying not to buy an iPad but if this keeps up I probably will. even though I love amazon I'm very close to switching!
Reviews.Title: not what I expected

Reviews.Author: kath
Reviews.Content: Purchased Dec 10, 2012.  Battery dead January 2014.  Return deadline December 14th, 2013!!!  Battery Plus says no to replacing battery.  Online reviews for replacement battery are very negative.I got a call from Amazon from tech support after posting the above review.  Adam fixed the Kindle over the phone.  He walked me thru a hard re-boot. If you have a problem with your Kindle, call them.  I never had ANY idea how to contact anyone at Amazon for tech support.  Thank you Adam. I am a happy Kindle user again...and just downloaded my second Caroline Oceana Ryan novel about Ireland. Brilliant! Adventures in Belfast: Northern Irish Life After the Peace AgreementAvailable in the Kindle Store at http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00I9OL68YHere is the contact information for KINDLE as they gave it to me:If you have any questions or need any help, you can reach us by phone directly and toll free from many countries by clicking the Contact Us option in the right-hand column of our Kindle Support pages:http://www.amazon.com/kindlesupportWhen you visit our website and select the Contact Us button on any Help page (www.amazon.com/help), click on the "Phone" tab, enter your number, and we'll call you right back. We're available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.Contacting us through the website allows you to verify security before a call is placed and ensures we have your account information ready when we call you. If your country isn't listed or you're unable to take advantage of the Contact Us feature, you can call us directly at 1-877-453-4512 or 1-206-266-0927 (if you're calling from outside the U.S.).Please note: this e-mail was sent from an address that cannot accept incoming e-mail.If you need further assistance, please visit: http://www.amazon.com/help
Reviews.Title: Dead Battery

Reviews.Author: G. hudson
Reviews.Content: To be very blunt, the silk browser is very crappy. It constantly freezes, even if you clear the browser data and closes and reboot.  It gets very irritating when it freezes every 30-45 seconds and it tell you silk browser not responding .  It freezes no matter what articles you are reading even Facebook. I  wish I had taken the money I spent on this tablet and purchased an iPad instead.
Reviews.Title: Freezes constantly when trying to read an article.

Reviews.Author: Janet
Reviews.Content: I bought the 8.9 and 7" inch Kindle Fire HD.  After a year of use these kindle have a big problem with the charging connection.  I have had to have the 8.9" inch kindle replaced and even the replacement is starting to have the same issue.  Its very frustrating when you plug in your kindle to charge pick it up hours later and nothing.  You have to wiggle the cord until you make the connection then you pray as you close it and put it down it did not move, even slightly.  My two kindles spent more time on charger then they are used now.If I didn't have this charging issue I would give them a five stars.  Love the Kindle, but if you cant use them they are worthless.
Reviews.Title: Has a major problem with charging

Reviews.Author: angela
Reviews.Content: My Kindle one day just stopped charging. Actually it says charging in one second then goes back to not charging. I think something is lose in the device because it will not charge anymore and I swear I did not mistreat my kindle. It has never once been dropped, tossed, or been under any kind of stress. I used to love my kindle but not anymore. It breaks too easily. I only had this kindle for a month!
Reviews.Title: I was afraid of this

Reviews.Author: C. Franklin
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Kindle Fire 7" for several years, decided to give it to my husband & treat myself to the Kindle HD 8.9".  It is very much like the 7" - picture is better, of course bigger screen - I would give this 5 stars IF & this is a BIG IF a charger was included & not have to be purchased separately to the tune of $20.00!!!  Outrageous....... my other complaint is there is NO CHARGING LIGHT.  As on my 7" - I like looking,once it's plugged in, for the red charging light, then seeing the green light when it is charged.  Honestly, what were you thinking Amazon when you decided to pass on this simple option????  Major oversights in my opinion - no charger & no  charging light........so disappointing.....
Reviews.Title: Amazon - include a CHARGER with Kindles.........

Reviews.Author: Paulette Lane
Reviews.Content: the silk browser freezes up and goes down alot.  You have to close out.  This makes surfing the web difficult and frustrating.
Reviews.Title: browser

Reviews.Author: Kflan61
Reviews.Content: Battery life was very poor. Did not last anywhere near 10 hours.  It also took forever to charge and would actually loose battery charge plugged in if you were streaming a movie!
Reviews.Title: Poor battery performance

Reviews.Author: Ms. S. Jeannie "Good or bad, my opinions are ...
Reviews.Content: Let me just start by saying that I absolutely ¢¾LOVE¢¾ the text-to-speech feature.  I love it so much that this, alone gets FIVE STARS from me.  However, it goes downhill from there.  One of the MOST annoying things about this device is that when browsing, it often FREEZES and I then have to shut down the device (restart) in order to accomplish anything.  The other thing that I don't like (which is totally not Amazon's fault) is that there is no Adobe Flash Player capability on this device.  So, any web site that requires Flash Player, is useless to me.  I have seen all of the "work-arounds", but am unwilling to compromise my warranty in any way.Now, back to what I like:  The large screen is delightful, the sound is devine and it has a camera...something that I did not have with my first-generation Kindle Fire.\Over all, it's just okay.  Glad I didn't have to pay full price.  I got it as a replacement for my 1st-generation Kindle Fire, which, by the way, I have had to replace EVERY YEAR.  First one just didn't work after a year and the second one had issues with the charging port (which is a common problem with that generation Kindle Fire).  Unfortunately, the second one was out of warranty...so they offered this one to me at a reduced rate.  I am hopeful that it will last me longer than one year.  If not, I will let you all know.
Reviews.Title: It's Just Okay

Reviews.Author: Jennifer Gibson
Reviews.Content: I decided it was time to upgrade since there are so many newer versions out there.  I upgraded from the Kindle Fire 7" first generation, I got it the week they were introduced.  If I had gotten the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" first, I might like it better but I have several things that I like better about the first generation.  I really would like for there to be a light that comes on when it is charging like on the first generation.  Twice now I have plugged it in only to come back hours later and still find the battery dead because the little light was not there telling me that it was indeed charging.  I like the favorites being displayed on the screen at all times also (as in the first generation), having to touch the star and then make my choice is just annoying when I'm used to it being on the screen all the time.  The screen quality is great (I wouldn't go so far as to say better than the original version though).  The sound quality is good.  I bought one with 32GB instead of 8GB which of course I love, but honestly I wish I had just stuck with my first one and not purchased this one.  I'm not giving it a bad review, like I said, I would like it if were my first Kindle purchase, but it's not and 9 times out of 10 I still grab my 7" over this one.
Reviews.Title: Upgraded from a Kindle Fire first generation

Reviews.Author: Wendy Louise Boyle
Reviews.Content: I just received my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" as a replacement to my first edition Kindle Fire. So far, I really like it - the size, clarity, color is perfect, The only issue that I have is the Power button doesn't light up. It would have been nice to have this include an LED.
Reviews.Title: Really Like It!

Reviews.Author: Jay from Redmond
Reviews.Content: This is a nice tablet, but not perfect.Pros:**** reader:  very nice reader, including in the daytime.  Since it is a color display, it probably isn't best for reading in sunshine, but for me, reading in the shade on a sunny day is fine.***** video:  very nice.  I have Amazon Prime, so can watch movies.  Nice, fun!Cons:** speed:  sometimes okay, sometimes surprisingly slow.  Slow perf is usually when surfing the web.* Silk web browser:  silk frequently gets unresponsive, and offers to close itself** weight:  it is a bit heavy, at least for holding vertically to read booksOverall:Clearly it is  a compromise for being both a reader and a video machine and a web browsing tablet.In retrospect, I wish I had gotten the 7" just to be lighter weight, as I primarily use it as book reader
Reviews.Title: Nice but not perfect

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this in January and returned it almost immediately, but am only now writing a review for it. The hardware is fine, but I hate the carousel "frequently used" interface (every album you play gets added to it, quickly cluttering it up and requiring manual removal) and locked-down app store (with like 1% of the google play store's app selection), and Silk is the most unstable web browser I've used since Netscape 4. I highly recommend going with a Nexus 7" or 10" instead.
Reviews.Title: Great hardware, terrible software

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have spent hours and hours with Kindle Technicians trying to fix a bug in it that won't allow me to download or read books on it.  They keep promising me to fix the problem but they don't.  They keep promising that their technical division will soon be back with me but they never contact me.
Reviews.Title: Bad Kindle

Reviews.Author: nyc "nyc"
Reviews.Content: The new Kindle Fire 8.9" HD can't do Internet very well. They don't have Flash, so they cannot play videos on websites that have them.Plus videos from Amazon that are in standard formats don't look so good in HD.  Image size on 8.9 are not much bigger than the (1st gen) old 7"--only 1" more due to wide margins on the sides of the screen.  Definitely don't get the new (HD) 7" if you can get the old 7" because the screen on the old one is more proportional for movies or if you want to watch videos on websites.If people get the HD, then 8.9 is better if one can afford it. The good things about the HD version is that the sound is better as the surround sound is noticeable, HD video does look HD, and it can be connected to the television through a purchased HDMI cable (not an option on the old or HDX version).  Other than those few things, the functionality are similar on the old and the new HD Kindle Fires.On my HD Fire, it occasionally had problems downloading or streaming videos from my Amazon account. The cursor would spin and spin until I leave a few times from the video and return later to play it again. This could be because of a slower speed on my internet.  With HD, you do want higher memory storage and Internet speed to run 100% smoothly.I think if you never owned the 1st generation Kindle Fire, this 8.9" HD would seem like it is an amazing technology as it has a smooth look and feel. I would have probably given this a 4 or 5 stars if this was my first Kindle Fire.  However, for those of us who owned the 1st generation Kindle Fire, by comparison, we are not as impressed by the upgrades because though there were improvements, Amazon also took away some of the good stuff that the old version had in its system including physical components such as button locations and charging light, etc.
Reviews.Title: Go with 8.9" HD for surround sound, HD videos and tv connectivity, but stick with 1st gen Kindle Fire for internet videos

Reviews.Author: candi
Reviews.Content: What can I say... I LOVE the Kindle Fire. I am a fan 100%. The Kindle Fire HD 8.9  is my second one. I started with the original 1st generation when it first came out. Since then, I've upgraded  to this one. It's fantastic, as usual,  the hd is beautiful, the graphics, colors, and clarity. There are quite a few different features. There's Skype; more speakers for better sound quality. And there's a different look here and there. Amazon keeps making them better and better.***UPDATE: Do not get discouraged and ditch this device or any new kindle fires, because there's no flash player. ALL TABLETS do not have it, including iPads. Adobe is to blame for this not Amazon or any other company. Adobe has pulled the plug on installing flash on all phones and all tablets. They are sticking only to computers. Now, the beauty of these tablets (the Kindle fires) is that they are ANDROID, people.:) There's a remedy for that. So, don't hate the Kindle Fire. Since, we are all one kindle fire family, here goes: (1). Go to settings, device, allow installation of outside applications select "yes". (2). Download from the Amazon Appstore Es File Explorer (3). Go to the web and search - download dolphin browser. (4). Then using dolphin browser search - download Adobe flash player 11. (5). If needed go to Es File Explorer, go to downloads and install from there. That's it. Now you should have flash player. However, to use the flash player you need to use the dolphin browser because it will not work on the Kindle fire's Silk browser. The Silk browser has an experimental video streamer but it does not work on all videos.Without flash the Kindle Fire is still a great tablet, so, either way enjoy.
Reviews.Title: Love it!

Reviews.Author: Mary Mathews
Reviews.Content: Silk  Browser is terrible!!  I had a first generation Kindle and really liked it but then it wouldn't take a charge which I understand is a common problem.  I was given the option to upgrade to this one at a reduced price so decided it do it.  I like the bigger screen.It seems thinner than my other kindle which is nice.  LIke the graphics, etc.  However, the Silk Browser is terrible.  Almost every time I try to go on the web it freezes.  Or doesn't load.  I got in touch with customer service.
