The Facebook app is incredibly glitchy and in group pages will show the first five posts, but beyond that it's just a gray background with posts shown, but no way to like or comment on the post itself, and no way to click on the post or the author's profile. In these posts the pictures are also not displayed. That is very frustrating since one of the main reasons I bought this device is to use it to buy/sell items in fb buy/sell/trade groups. It is impossible for me to do that since I can't even see what other people are posting. I called Kindle tech support about this two weeks ago and  they said they could not find a fix because it was a previously unknown issue, even though I can see in the Kindle forums where people have been having this exact same problem since at least 2012. I keep getting emails from them saying they have not yet found a fix and are continuing to look into the problem. I doubt it will ever get fixed. The app selection is disappointing also, because of the exclusion of Google based apps, and other fairly common apps in Android and Apple stores. If you plan to use this as a tablet, don't waste your money. A device that is functional solely through the use of it's apps becomes useless when it's apps themselves are not up to speed, and the selection of available apps leaves a lot to be desired. I researched for a long time before making this purchase and thought I was making a wise decision going with the Kindle. I expected it to be fun to use and helpful, but it's been one disappointment after another. If you are looking for a killer e-reader buy this, if you are looking for a tablet, buy an iPad.
Reviews.Title: Great as an e-reader, terrible as a tablet.

Reviews.Author: Catboy55
Reviews.Content: The complaints about this are unfounded. Amazon has an AMAZING no hassle return policy. So buy one...this one is 229.00 for the big 8.9" screen. If you hate it...send it back for a quick refund. Does any other tablet maker offer that kind of risk free policy? No. And they do it because they know their product rocks...and no I am not an employee...just a HUGE fan. Ex iPad user...
Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted!

Reviews.Author: Wendy Wilkins
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle for reading books, emails and any online activity. I also have an Ipad, and have found the Kindle to be more difficult to understand the functions and how to get around. But I love reading books on it.
Reviews.Title: Wonderful for reading.

Reviews.Author: jaap schuiling
Reviews.Content: Bought this Kindle Fire HD Tablet in the first place to be able to read the books i bought and will buy in the Kindle store everywhere i want.I am very happy with the quality and all the options for reading.Also listning to music and watching videos is of high quality.It's only not possible to buy music and movies from Amazon because i don't live in the US,that's the only reason i didn;t rate 5 stars.Perfect Tablet!!
Reviews.Title: Very happy with this KIndle Fire HD Tablet

Reviews.Author: Phillip Centola
Reviews.Content: Unit is better than the original Kindle Fire. I was hoping for a better charging system. I had trouble with the original Kindle Fire charging system. The connections became loose on two different units. I still think that Kindle is number one for E-Reader type systems, and will continue to buy Kindles.
Reviews.Title: Better than the original Kindle fire

Reviews.Author: brainless
Reviews.Content: The internet runs really slow and some of the videos stop right in the middle and have to start all over again.  It's not my internet because I don't have that problem on any of my other devices.
Reviews.Title: Not so great.

Reviews.Author: Glenna J Dooley
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 about 4 months ago.  I've given it a pretty good test, but I find I keep going back to my iPad.The biggest issue I have with the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is using it to actually type something.  I hate the keyboard.  It does not seem to be calibrated at all and I haven't found a way to calibrate it.  You touch on a key and nine times out of ten you get one somewhere around it and auto-correct inserts whatever word it wants to.  I have turned auto-correct, auto-capitalization and next word prediction off but it still seems to throw in whatever word it wants to. I spend more time correcting auto-correct changes than I do typing a document.  I don't want to have to watch the screen when I'm typing something.  Here is what the Kindle fire typed as the first few words of this paragraph:  The biggrdt isshr i ba  eithtbr Kidke fiI read a lot, so I am amassing a large library - some of it replacing my hardback/paperback books which I am donating to charity.  It is lighter than my old first generation iPad, but I've been using the Kindle app for years, and an eReader is my choice for reading now.I purchased the WiFi enabled version because I don't take it anywhere that I would need 3 or 4 g connectivity.  Even with WiFi it seems a little slow to connect to the internet, but that's okay.  I'm not impressed with many of the apps out there - I've tried a few of the free ones because I won't purchase any apps until I test them out.I do not regret purchasing the Kindle Fire, but if I could have afforded it, I would have purchased another iPad.
Reviews.Title: It's OKAY

Reviews.Author: Terry Ayers
Reviews.Content: We have both an iPad as well as the Kindle. The Kindle Fire HD is hands down the clear cut winner!
Reviews.Title: It is a cut above many higher priced tablets on the marketplace!

Reviews.Author: Maria G. Medina "FOOFAH"
Reviews.Content: i love it. the screen is so much better. the games are bigger. for people who need larger print because they can't read small print this is perfect. i love watching films  on this screen. the picture is so clear. the sound is amazing. i workout to music on my kindle.i do my banking. i contact my family with my kindle. i take pictures with my kindle. my cousin works for apple and she is trying to get me to buy an ipad. no way. leave me and my kindle alone.  i'm a kindle girl through and through.
Reviews.Title: new 8.9

Reviews.Author: D. M. Nicol
Reviews.Content: I enjoy my Kindle and find it easy to operate. I was hesitant to buy one but now I'm very glad I did.
Reviews.Title: Love it!

Reviews.Author: ASG "angryshortguy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my father in law who is in an assisted living home.We wanted him to be able to go online and get the scores from all the state high school football games, and play some card games to keep him occupied.The interface is really not very intuitive.To get out of a game, he had to touch a very tiny tab on screen.I even had trouble hitting it just right to work.Ads, ads, everywhere.And not just ads, annoying and confusing ads came up from the opening screen to the confusing row of apps under the favorites I set up for him.Touch screen with no touch.I had this thing set up and ready to go.I sat down with him to make sure he could use it.tapping icons were difficult for him.He kept tapping and tapping, but nothing happened.He started to get frustrated.I took over to show him how to do it, and it wouldn't work for me either.I must have tapped an icon 6 times before it finally registered.If the touch screen doesn't work, what good is a tablet.Taking it back for a full refund.You really DO get what you pay for.
Reviews.Title: horrible touch screen response

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I started with a Kindle 2 keyboard device and used it faithfully for several years until it started to do freaky things like suddenly going back to the beginning of my book or shutting itself off and refusing to turn on.Then I got my Kindle Touch which I am still using for outdoor reading and reading while I walk on the treadmill.Next I received as a gift the very first Kindle Fire ... that is now starting to act a little strange at times.So here I am now with my brand new Kindle Fire HD 8.9 ... and so far so good ... I'm quite happy with it. The picture is very clear and it makes the game graphics pop. I also love the 2 page viewing option for reading and the fact that it tells me how many minutes it will take to read a chapter. This way I know right away if I have the time to finish it or not and can decide if I want to start to read it or stop where I'm at. You can also choose to have it show the time it will take to finish the entire book, the page you are on or the location #. It's so nice to have the ability to choose what you like the most.Barbara GarberPottstown PA
Reviews.Title: As always ... Great Device ...

Reviews.Author: Marte Holley
Reviews.Content: Kindle products are the best.  Easy to use, and ample choice in product store online.  I am on my 3rd.  Love the Kindle Fire HD 8.9".  Good size, brilliant visuals.  Be sure to get the case.  It turns off, or puts in sleep mode, when not in use.
Reviews.Title: They just keep getting better!

Reviews.Author: Javier
Reviews.Content: For my father in law. He loves it, it's his first ever computer phone/tablet type device. He is 66 yrs old and has never had an email account. Nice to get him out there into CYBER SPACE.
Reviews.Title: It was a FATHER's Day GIFT

Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I spent considerable time looking for what I wanted and needed in a tablet. At times I was so confused and frustrated that I consider getting another laptop instead. I shopped on line and in store, talking with others, reading articles, getting as much info as possible. My needs are basic and I live quite happily without Microsoft's products.I'm a housepainter who loves to read, plays guitar, loves rock and roll, conservative news junkie, somewhat of a hermit who connects with life-long friends via social networks and email. I decided on a kindle upgrade and frankly,I couldn't be happier. I made an excellent and affordable choice. One of the factors precipitating my decision is how much I value the state of the art customer service i have already come to experience with Amazon.I am not a techie, so I can't tell you how great the specs are, but for ease of use, dependability and efficiency, I couldn't be happier.I'm 63 years old now and I appreciate the simplicity of operation as well.Five stars easily. I requested a refurbished device but they sent me a brand new one at the refurbished price.lucky guy! I think Amazon is attempting and succeeding at providing flawless customer service which counts a lot with me.
Reviews.Title: excellent choice

Reviews.Author: Tes Got It
Reviews.Content: I have the Kindle fire. It used to be just for reading, online stuff. Then I found I could watch TV shows on it. As far as I'm concerned this is the only way to watch TV and movies. However with very limited space it became frustrating. I researched the different tablets, price compared, ratings. I don't believe I'll ever be an Apple Imac purchaser. I am very happy with Amazon's android connection. As to the reason for my purchase, I can download now with what seems unlimited space. I actually don't know the limit because I watch and delete. The size had taken some getting use to, it's quite a bit larger than the Fire. The charger I think is in an inconvenient spot. However, the picture is amazing. It's quite a bit faster than the Fire. My Ipad friends are quite amazed too. I'm no techie, but I know what works for me. And come on.... $200-$300 less for the Kindle. It really was a no-brainer.
Reviews.Title: Perfect for TV and movies

Reviews.Author: Phyl Worm "Ultimate Book Worm"
Reviews.Content: Love my new KINDLE FIRE and so glad I went with the BIGGER size!  I'm 72 years young and just love this product! So easy to read and easy even for me to work with!
Reviews.Title: AWESOME!

Reviews.Author: Irene Orino
Reviews.Content: It sometimes gets stuck and you can't move on.  I have to go to another game .  I do enjoy playing with this at night and am really glad to get so many games to try out free.
Reviews.Title: Using the Kindle

Reviews.Author: supersun45
Reviews.Content: I have this Kindle Fire for a couple months now. I bought it with some of my graduation money. A friend of mine has an Ipad so I used to get on his, but they're too expensive for my price rang. I actually like this better. It's just as good as an Ipad, and way tougher. The screen hasn't gotten scratched once, and this is with no screen protector. I did buy a case, but that's more for standing it up when I watch movies and shows. Overall, I am blown away by this. The picture is incredible, and the sound is amazing. It's like HD sound. The Wi-Fi speed is great as well, perfect for streaming. Speaking of, the battery life is astounding. With a full battery, I can watch Netflix for well over eight hours. I haven't used Skype at all so I can't say anything about that. The touchscreen is amazingly responsive.Even though this device is tough, it's still lightweight, which is the best thing I can ask for. I'll be keeping it in my backpack when school starts this fall and I don't want something heavy weighing me down. Basically, it's perfect. Now, the screen is a little smaller than an Ipad, but that is not a con in my book. If anything, it just makes it easier to hold your hand, especially when your reading.
Reviews.Title: Awesome product

Reviews.Author: Tammy McCray
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a tablet with a bigger screen that I could carry around with me but wouldn't be too heavy.  I have a regular Kindle which I used to carry around and read books on.  Like I said, I wanted something with a bigger screen and also something that I could connect to the internet, read emails, etc.  After comparing the Kindle Fire HD with iPads, etc. the price was just to good to resist.  I love my Kindle Fire HD.  The only thing I do not like about it, is that the camera is front facing only.  I'm still trying to learn how to take pictures without being in them!
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire for me

Reviews.Author: Curt Cleancut
Reviews.Content: I've had my Kindle for a few months. My family loves it. I was worried that the Kindle wouldn't stand up to the Ipad but it truly does. It's half the price and virtually offers the same services. Amazon allows users to "backdoor" Android apps. That's a huge plus. There are TONS of apps available between both Kindle Amazon and Android. My son is almost 2 and we've loaded preschool apps for him to use as well. He's literally learning to count and has pretty much mastered his alphabet with some of the apps. I'm getting my wife one of these soon before I deploy. Lol I'm scared to leave her and my son without it when I leave. We'll be able to Skype without me having to lug around my laptop overseas!!!!I'm obviously happy with my investment. It was a solid choice.
Reviews.Title: Awesome Product:

Reviews.Author: Patricia Moore
Reviews.Content: I would have given this a 5 star rating if it weren't for a couple of things. One - the camera is on the wrong side. It is very difficult to take pictures and videos when you can't see what you are taking the picture or video of. Two - there is no indicator light to let you know when charging is complete. I still have lots to learn but don't expect any other problems. I kinda wish I would have waited til they had been out a while to see if the inconveniences were addressed.
Reviews.Title: Needs design changes

Reviews.Author: marcblue
Reviews.Content: I gave the "Fire" a Five Star rating because after performing a thorough review of the product before purchasing, I knew exactly what I was getting. As a result, the "Fire" either met or exceeded my expectations. I've read a number reviews that criticized the device for not having Adobe Flash. Evidently, these commentators did not read other reviews explaining that Adobe (NOT AMAZON) was no longer supporting Flash in mobile devices. However, other users provided a step by step workaround solution that works great! Others have complained that photo taking is next to impossible. Evidently, they did not understand or did not read the "specs" that the camera was designed for Skype (rear lens only) and no front lens for taking photos. The more I use the "Fire" the more adept I have become. I find the typing and the word completion relatively easy. I've downloaded movies and watched TV shows from Comcast, Netflix and Amazon without a problem. There is even an app that I installed that allows me to transfer documents from my PC to the "Fire" for personal reference. I've downloaded my personal videos and transferred music that I purchased from Apple  to the "Fire."The only decision that I may have 2nd thoughts on was purchasing the 32 gig instead of the 64 gig because not be able to add memory.All and all the "Fire", "especially for the money" has met all of my expectations.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Expectations

Reviews.Author: Barry Irwin
Reviews.Content: I have found many things I enjoy doing with the Kindle.  I am still learning of its possibilities.  The HD screen makes watching movies very enjoyable even though the screen is smaller than a TV.  I like the portablility of it.  I can have internet connections in any room.  It is very useful when I work on the car in the garage and the service manual is online.  It took a while to figure out how to transfer music and pictures using the cloud.  I bought a leather case for it for about $14 so it can stand up on its own.  You don't need an expensive case but you do need a case to protect it.  The battery lasts for quite a while with normal use.  I just charge it overnight.  I bought a bluetooth headset and with these items I am in my own world.  I can't compare it to other tablets since this is the only one I have owned but it does what I need.
Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!

Reviews.Author: Patty O'Club "Silverthread"
Reviews.Content: I am not a technophile; not an Early Adopter,  When the Kindle was introduced, it seemed an extravagant gadget to me, and I had no interest in acquiring one.  By the time the Kindle Fire HD was released, several of my friends owned them, and I changed my opinion--for someone with vision issues, the ability to increase a font size with a tiny touch was a real enticement, and so Santa brought me a Kindle Fire HD 8.9 for Christmas.I am a Voracious Reader; my library card is cracked from overuse.  I quickly became addicted to my new Kindle Fire, and it became a staple of my day...until last Saturday.  It stopped charging.  It's little life support system stopped working, and the power just wouldn't flow into it.  In a panic, I contacted the online chat to sort through the steps that would bring my Kindle back to life.Asha, the support tech, patiently walked me through several attempts to restore life, but in the end, we called the time of death and I was very sad.  Asha said she would send me a new one, and that it would arrive two days later.  She did.  It did.I cannot overstate how delighted I am.  Bad things happen to good electronics and when they do, we hope for a resolution.  The Kindle support team went above and beyond for me to restore what I had.  Every book I purchased is accessible (in fact, when I turned on the new Kindle after downloading it, the book I was reading opened to the page I'd been reading on the old one).Thank you, Asha.  Thank you, Amazon.  I'm going to go read now.
Reviews.Title: A Love Note to Amazon Support Team

Reviews.Author: Jeff Konowal
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this as a gift to myself for Father's day, an upgrade from the original Fire I bought when that first came out.  I like the size, thickness and  graphics, but mostly bought this for the larger screen.  I am indifferent about the screensaver ads and the endless recommendations I get with my existing apps, since these apparently allowed me to buy at a discount (advertised as "Special Offers").  I see no difference in the upgraded Wi-Fi (the signal dead spots in my house are the same in either model) and the sound (other than a bit more volume).The three things that ARE problematic are the power/volume buttons, the power/HDMI connections and the magnetic on/off switch.1.  The power and volume buttons are located next to each other on one side of the case.  This is more a first world problem, but when using manually turning the device off, it is common to change the volume instead, and if you are manually changing the volume, you can easily turn off the device.  I would have stayed with a software volume control only, like the original.2.  While the display rotates to adjust to the position of the the device, there is still a default position.  For apps like Netflix, this means that the device has to be in the horizontal with the power and hdmi connections at the bottom.  When using a case or propping it up for viewing, this means that you can't have the power or HDMI connected without raising the device up a few inches. I would have run these from the side (like the original) or out the top.  When running multimedia like video, the power doesn't last long enough for a full movie, so a power connection is a must.3.  I bought a case to protect my Kindle since I tend to be hard on my electronics.  There are magnets in the cover that turns the Kindle off when closing.  This is a nice feature with one drawback.  When using the Kindle, I fold the front cover to the back, but since the device is so thin, the magnets turn the Kindle off from the back.  I find myself removing the case more often than not to avoid this.  Since the case is from a secondary vendor, I can't say this is a consistent problem.An additional issue is that some apps I bought for the old Kindle are not compatible with the new one.  I bought Monopoly and Dungeon Hunter 2, to find that they supposedly don't work with the HD version.  There may be others I haven't looked for yet, but this is maddening in that these apps should at least be patched or upgraded, since they are Android tablet apps.  If the rate of app obsolescence is going to be this high with every upgrade, I would advise anyone to be VERY picky about their app purchases from Amazon.One last item is the speakers, which reside somewhat on the sides and wrap to the back.  I found that by cupping the speakers to direct the sound to the front during use improves the volume and quality tremendously.  This isn't possible when using a case.  I assume the position of the speakers is for better sound distribution, specifically when using as a radio or MP3 player, but for movies and games it sucks.I have already given my old Kindle to my daughter, so I can't go back.  But in hindsight, I probably would not have switched had I known about these issues.
Reviews.Title: Still Needs Some Improvement

Reviews.Author: Gayla Hill
Reviews.Content: I paid $5.00 on a raffle for my very first Kindle. Then I upgraded to the Fire about a year and a half ago when they first came out. I loved it! Recently I had trouble getting the battery to charge. Amazon was wonderful in how they attempted to fix the Fire even though I didn't buy an extended warranty. They made me an offer I couldn't refuse, I turned in my old Fire and upgraded to the 8.9" Fire. It may not seem like it is that much bigger, unless you have used the 7" version. I never went anywhere without my old Fire and this one is going to be the same way. I have friends who have I-Pads and they all comment about how nice my new Fire is compared to what they have. For the price, you can't touch it! I have recommended this to everyone!
Reviews.Title: I love it!

Reviews.Author: BobinPV
Reviews.Content: WOW!  All I wanted and much more than I hoped for.  I am in my MID-70s and cautious around new, for me, technology. Have no fear, this Kindle Fire HD is very user-friendly and grows more easily navigated a day at a time. Thanks Amazon for this age-friendly winner.
Reviews.Title: A love affair from the start!

Reviews.Author: Pat Bradshaw "Pati"
Reviews.Content: I had the 7" Kindle and had to keep turning the pages (which is easy but boring. I am a fast readerso now I can read on a bigger screen that lets me read longer on a larger view page
Reviews.Title: Great size ereader

Reviews.Author: Edith Simpson
Reviews.Content: Love the Fire; it's my first tablet.  For a 53 year old geezer, it was easy and often fun to set up and learn, much to my surprise.  The HD video is brilliantly clear, easy on the eyes, and enables me to read even smaller fonts.  I've had it about 6 weeks and have used it for books, magazines, email thru AOL, web, stream movies (alone or thru TV with available micro-USB to HDMI cable), music from cloud or device, stream Pandora, various other apps including GPS in the car.  I found these accessories from Amazon very convenient/necessary:  Kindle Powerfast charger, wifi at home, Marware stylus, Moshi ivisor screen protector, Bear Motion folio case (but have not found the keyboard necessary for short emails), ihome portable speaker.  You will definitely want to use your own headphones or external speakers for great music or movie audio.  NOTE: although I use my home wifi for web use at home including all downloading, while traveling I quickly used up the monthly allotted time on the data plan.  ** You will not be able to rely on only the data plan without wifi!  I now consider the data plan as only a backup connection.
Reviews.Title: Fire is great; Wireless plan inadequate

Reviews.Author: David J. Roberts "Doc"
Reviews.Content: I really like the 2nd generation Kindle. I have had a Kindle since they stated making the things... but, and this is a big but: the new Kindle 8.9 and the Amazon "recommended" case sometimes have a fight! Yes, the case looks great and works well... most of the time.I load a app from the Amazon store and it hangs the Kindle... no movement of any kind. So I know what to do since the "tested" apps are sometimes junk or worse and this has happened before. I press the start button and hold for 20 seconds, and the Kindle goes to sleep. But not like any Kindle before this one.I press the start button again and it reboots and comes up in "SAFE MODE"... down in the lower right corner are the words. I try to run any app and no success. So I call Amazon, and a very nice fellow from a very far place walks me through a few things and then declares that he will send me a new Kindle at no charge. And I must say Amazon's customer service is always great.But I am a scientist guy and retired so I have lots of time on my hands and want to get to the bottom of this SAFE MODE thing. So I get on the Internet and sure enough there is a fix... hold the volume and start button down at the same time to toggle SAFE MODE on and off. Of course, I try this but no success.Then I get an idea... I take the Kindle out of the case and press the two buttons at the same time and guess what? SUCCESS!!!The *&^$ case was the problem. It seems that it (the case) was pressing the volume button when I pressed the start button for a reboot.Now you know the secret and you can mess with the case to get out of SAFE MODE.BTW: The Kindle is a great machine and Amazon's service is the best... just one of those things...
Reviews.Title: I Like My Kindle 8.9

Reviews.Author: M. R.
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Great for reading books! - Good for listening to music. - Good for watching movies.Cons: - It get's slow (when using any store apps other than anything preinstalled). I go to "Settings" once in a while to "kill running applications" which seems to help for a little while but then it gets slow again.I wish they'd add a "Pronounce" button to listen to word's pronunciations when looking up definitions. I also wish double-tap on text would work like on iOS devices (zooming in only the portion that I need rather than random parts of it).I would recommend for reading books/watching videos/listening to music and browsing the web once in a while (after you install Google Chrome from apk since it's not in the store). I would not recommend it for anything else (games, skype, facebook, etc).
Reviews.Title: Great for reading books

Reviews.Author: Angelica
Reviews.Content: I would've given the kindle fire hd a higher rating if it didnt constantly freeze and restart. I love all the features of the device but the fact is the feautures are useless if the device freezes when you try to use it. I was told to clear the history and the cache to clear up the problem but it still happens. I was also told that the problem probably occurs because I have heavy internet usage. I dont even use the device every day or every other day most of the time so not sure what qualifies as heavy usage. I find myself using my laptop more than the kindle nowdays to avoid the frustration. It does work well as far as an e-reader but in that case I couldve purchased the regular kindle. Starting to think I should've paid the extra money to get the iPad.
Reviews.Title: constantly freezes

Reviews.Author: csm
Reviews.Content: We need this for our school district and boy, are we ever glad that we bought this over the Ipad.  When the kids take this thing to school, the kids with the ipads wish desperately that they had this 32gb Kindle just based on all that it can do.  Particularly if you're looking for something for kids to learn on, you really go wrong with this, especially for the price.  I just wasn't too thrilled about coughing up $800 for a device that was going to school every day.  This thing, however, outshines that ipad and the teachers are so impressed with it that they are suggesting that the rest of the classroom purchase these for use.Check the above comparisons to make your final decision. Plus, there's a guy on here that reviewed this and said to just get the 32gb over the 64 and keep your cell phone separate because this is awkward to use as a phone.  SO helped my decision!  And really, the 32 is the best bang for your buck, hands down, unless, of course, you're a high gb user and need the 64.  The huge screen on this thing is awesome - it works like a dream and we've been nothing but pleased this entire time that we've been using it.  It's a great choice for classwork, from elementary up to even college and if you buy an Otterbox cover for it, it's virtually indestructible!This goes everywhere now, from school to Sunday school to the grocery store, you name it.  And with that Otterbox on it, I have peace of mind and know that it will last.  SO glad I did the research on this and made this decision.  Oh, almost forgot - when you put this in your shopping cart, amazon recommends an adaptor for $10.  Be SURE to order that as well to recharge your new Kindle since it does NOT come with one.  Highly recommend!
Reviews.Title: An amazing choice for school-aged children for classwork

Reviews.Author: Shari Riley
Reviews.Content: I already have the kindle fire 7" and love it to death, I take it with me everywhere, it's always in my purse. Now for the 8.9 wireless, I love the size but for different reasons, I read mostly and play the games I can without internet on the kindle fire 7", but the kindle fire 8.9 I can now watch movies, go on the internet, play games that require the internet, so it's kinda like a small laptop without a dvd player at half the size. For example I am planning on spending a lot of summer days at wet and wild in las vegas so I need the internet, so I'm not just stuck reading, but can also check my facebook or watch a movie.  I do have a smart phone but the screen is to small for my eyes, so that's my opinion of the fire HD 4G. I also bought the Bear wireless keyboard, and cover which is really nice if you hate typing on the screen and a waterproof cover to protect my kindle from water. Going to be a great summer in Vegas!!!
Reviews.Title: I am so grateful to have gotten this kindle

Reviews.Author: J.B.
Reviews.Content: I have to say I do love the Kindle Fire. When I decided to get a tablet, I researched all options. I checked out a few tablets at Costco and also looked at reviews. My priorities are/were: reading, videos, games. I didn't really see myself using the tablet as a laptop substitution or else i would have purchased a laptop.PROS:Easy to set up. No thought process whatsoever.Anything Amazon is amazingly simple as far as Kindle and Amazon are concerned.Sound is fantastic.Graphics are fantastic.Wifi is super fast.Structurally, IMO, it's a solid piece of equipment.CONS:Doesn't play nice with Google sometimesTHINGS BEYOND ITS FAULT:Flash. I know this is a common tablet problem, however.There are ways around any limitations you find. I don't regret my purchase at all, my friends who have tablets that were more expensive don't really have anything more than I have.I actually have since recanted my "no substitution for laptop" resolve and purchased a keyboard. The Kindle and keyboard paired wonderfully and while there's no DVD drive (but who really needs one), it's pretty much like having a laptop :)
Reviews.Title: Ahem.....flash? But that is a common problem.

Reviews.Author: Francis K. Doughan
Reviews.Content: Everything said about this mobile device by amazon is true. I bought it for my wife who is almost always on the move and it has excellently served its purpose so far. When out of town or country, myself and the kids are able to get in contact via skype.  She does not have to use her laptop while riding a train (equipped with wifi) in europe.  No one knows when she is reading her bible app and praying silently on the train,bus, and airplane. The stunning HD screen is superb. Being an avid movie lover, she watches movies free of charge to ward off the alone times.The only setback is that the camera could be upgraded to both front and back for more 'freedom'. I always can't wait to see my wife's beautiful face via skype when she is in Europe, thanks to Kindle Fire HD 8.9".
Reviews.Title: So Far So Good

Reviews.Author: kaitiaki
Reviews.Content: March 30, 2013Kindle Fire HD 8.9" showed up yesterday. Just checked it out and so far everything is ka pai. First, without a case it fits quite nicely in my man purse. Second, and more importantly, copied a PDF report from my computer hard drive to the Kindle document folder. Eminently readable with the Kindle's native PDF reader. So far I like. Seeking recommendations for a case/stand that's fairly compact.April 6, 2013The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is now clad in a purple i-Blason case/cover. Loaded several PDF reports I didn't print out. Readable with reading glasses. Case works well in preventing fingerprints (never realized how greasy I am) but probably won't do much protecting if I dropped the rig. But case doesn't increasing dimensionality significantly so I can still lug it around in my man purse--a feature more important to me than protection. Don't have wi-fi access so haven't loaded any apps thus cannot attest to the Kindle Fire HD's versatility. At present it is a fine PDF viewer which will always be its primary use.April 14, 2013IMPORTANT NOTICE FOR AARP MEMBERS: I found out too late, but there's a 10% discount coupon for Kindle readers on the AARP pages. [...]April 21, 2013Love affair with Kindle Fire HD 8.9" continues unabated. If anything, the flame burns brighter. No more stacks of GBC-bound documents cluttering up the place--well, no new stacks anyway. And an impression--now that I have some styli that work more effectively, I think the Kindle's form factor speeds up my reading--I can gobble up entire paragraphs without scanning side to side or up and down within a paragraph. And tapping the Kindle with a stylus is a lot faster than turning real pages. And colored graphs and charts appear to be more quickly comprehended. Couldn't afford to run color copies of documents. One downside is that I need to remember to rename PDFs on the desktop before copying them onto the Kindle. Also, without hard copies in hand, I find that I am not entering cataloging/indexing data into the Access database.
Reviews.Title: Good Stuff, No Make That Great Stuff

Reviews.Author: D. E. Keith
Reviews.Content: One of my better purchases. I do love my Kindle Fire HD. It is very user friendly, handy and entertaining. A vast array of Apps and games are available. If I have any complaint with my Kindle, it would be with the Kindle speakers. They are seriously lacking, but there is an App available to remedy that flaw. A simple suggestion to Amazon, consider boosting speakers  or sell external speakers so I can listen and adjust the volume separately.
Reviews.Title: Very impressive device

Reviews.Author: Thatonegirl_xoxo "ThatOneGirl_xoxo"
Reviews.Content: Purchase date: 3-1-13 I bought the Kindle Fire HD mainly because I ran out of room on my Kindle Fire. I only had 8GB available and with the things I read it didn't take long to fill but anyway...As for picture and sound I'd give them both a 10/10. I haven't had any problems with glares even when I'm outside. I do have a screen protector on mine but even with the screen protector it's still glare free. I'm a huge fan of watching Hulu and Youtube and it streams things perfectly.Books 10/10: What interested me the most in purchasing the HD was the whispersync feature. When you purchase a book it gives you the option to add voice to it for a couple extra dollars. And it turns the book into a professionally read audio book. I do recommend this option because the normal voice that you get without paying the extra couple of dollars is a very robotic GPS type sounding voice. In my opinion I don't mind if I pay a couple of extra bucks if it's a book I'm really looking forward too. The option is entirely up to you but sense I'm a big on books it's something I always consider.Web Browsing 9/10: The only reason I'm not giving this a perfect score is because I wish it had Flash. Yes, it is fast. Almost faster than my laptop but if it had Flash it would make it much better. I would like to be able to play Facebook games.App's (7/10): There were a few apps that were not available on Kindle HD that were available on my ipod. But it's not a big deal to me because I didn't buy it specifically for the apps I bought it for books.Look and appearance (8/10): The HD is a lot lighter than I expected. And I love having the bigger screen but it is a little clunky to me if you compare it to the Kindle Fire 7 inch. But it's just a minor adjustment that I've already gotten used too. In a way it reminds me about the size of a hardback book if you really think about it.Battery life (7/10): I can go several days without having to charge this device. But I gave it a 7 because I only got a USB port in the box and no wall charger. This turned out to be a big pet peeve with me and more of a pain. I tried to charge it through my computer but it didn't work. I had given my Mother my old Kindle Fire so I had to go out and purchase a separate wall charger. Why wouldn't you guys include the wall charger? Not all of us want to sync through our computers. Not to mention if we're going to invest in this much money there should be a wall charger included. So if that's the only complaint that I have about this device that is it that they don't include the wall charger.Side note: I know there isn't really a category for this suggestion but one thing I've noticed when searching for cases for my HD that there aren't very many yet. Maybe I'm just too picky but I was looking for a zip case one and I just couldn't find one I liked. I would like to see more cases for the HD other than just online. And Best Buy had a very few to choose from.Other than the charger issue I'm a happy Kindle Fire HD owner. I do think it is worth it to upgrade to the new version and I'm glad I did. I've had it almost a week now and I'm a happy camper. I like having a bigger screen, and I use the whispersync more than I thought I would. Above all I love having all of the extra room for more books!
Reviews.Title: A review from a book reader

Reviews.Author: Truessence "True"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" for my husband. I must say very impressive. I have the lastest Apple Ipad, and must say I still a fan of the Kindle Fire. So if you prefer not to spend the extra money on an Apple Ipad, this product can stand on his own. Money worth spending, plus my hubby is a happy man which is must important.Great Product!!!!
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"

Reviews.Author: Edwin A. Matzner "Edwin M"
Reviews.Content: None of the more advanced Kindles support the strong features of the original keyboard version.  Thus, Kindle for PC and Kindle Cloud cannot "search my items" (the global search in all books), and there are other weaknesses of the different operating systems.  Worst of all, the Kindle Fire does not support the "collections" feature, which I find very useful if one has many books, and on which, for my 450 books and some 25 "collections," I spent many months.  It was thus reluctantly that I had to return the Kindle Fire.  Otherwise, I would give it 5 stars, but to have to start collections again from scratch due to system incompatibility is hard.  Better feature integration would help.
Reviews.Title: Questionable feature integration

Reviews.Author: Curtis Ray Brown "Mindy Brown"
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire.  I do have a concern about the amount of battery life on my Kindle.  It does not seem to stay charged more than 24 hours.  I like to read all the time, I would rather do that than watch TV, so that is the only complaint I have about it.  I love how all the functions work.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire

Reviews.Author: Jamie Fornabaio
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with how fast it is. My kids hardly let me use it there are so many games and apps. I like that I can set the parental controls so they can't buy things without permission too.
Reviews.Title: I love it

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I LOVE my Kindle Fire HD 8.9"  This replaces my first gen Kindle Fire.  I am using my Fire HD so much more than the previous version.  I can't find anything I'm unable to do on it, inverse to the first gen.  Surfing on the web FAST and beautiful.  I purchased a keyboard case for it and use this constantly at work with Evernote.  I love how easy it is to add and find video content to add and then I can access through my Blu-ray player.  Way easier to search on the Kindle than via the player.  Given the daily usage and the multiple ways I use this it was money well spent.  Best purchase I've made in a long time!!!  The only con I've found is the one-way camera.  To take pictures of whiteboards for notes to share, it would be nice to have the rear-facing camera.... but I don't know if I'd be willing to pay more for it.
Reviews.Title: Worth the wait!!

Reviews.Author: Ann
Reviews.Content: This wonderful little device (already own Kindle Fire, 1st generation too) delivers everything is promises and more...had a little hard time setting up yahoo mail on it, but that was problem with yahoo, I am sure.The screen is BIG and wonderful....downloads are fast...dolby audio is great for the size they are, and nice to have on device, rather than have to hook up other listening itemsI have only had it a few weeks (Amazon tech support is GREAT)  I would highly recommend this device to everyone!
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 Rules!

Reviews.Author: Maile A. Lee
Reviews.Content: I think I fell in love!!! This was the best buy yet! I needed something that was portable and on the go but could also connect outside of Wi-Fi and I found it!
Reviews.Title: Great buy

Reviews.Author: diangirl
Reviews.Content: This little gadget is awesome fun! It took me awhile to get used to it because it's so much different from my usual Windows OS, but once I got it, my netbook went into retirement. Amazon has provided an App Store so that you can get apps that are compatible with the Kindle Fire (as some you find elsewhere are not), and I have downloaded a few that I like, especially Yukon Gold Solitaire. I watch TV shows, read my email and look at the news; use my blog site, and shop. It came with a free 30 day membership to Amazon Prime of which I am taking full advantage. I like free shipping!!I have to admit, it has a few cons. I'm still getting used to the touch keyboard and I hate the word prediction function, which I can't seem to get turned off. Also, there is no way to get pictures into it directly from a flash card or disc. You can use the Amazon Cloud Drive, Dropbox (or the like), or plug it in to your PC and drag and drop the files. This makes it useless to take on vacation as I like to put my pictures from the day on my computer to look at directly from the flash card.You will want a stylus for some of the tiny buttons. The HD picture quality is great, but there is quite a lot of glare, so I got an anti glare screen protector. Warning!!! These are very difficult to apply! Read the instructions and be prepared to use the words your mother warned you against! As for the camera, it only faces inward (towards your face), so you can't take pictures of anything in front of you--but you can use your phone for that. And get a charger; it doesn't come with one.The battery life seems pretty good. I've watched a couple of TV shows and more before it tells me to plug it in. It's very light weight. The sound quality is excellent. I may have to get some speakers to take better advantage of that.The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" met all of my expectations and is a lot of fun. I got a good deal on it, so I feel it was good value for money. If you want to watch TV or movies, check your email, play games, read, shop and a lot more while away from home or your PC---and if you want a cool new toy---get yourself one of these!
Reviews.Title: So Much Fun!

Reviews.Author: Sarah "thebookpusher"
Reviews.Content: I have had every single Kindle model created before this one.  I have loved every single one and passed them down the family as soon as the latest and greatest came out.I use the Kindle for everything Amazon wants us to use it for.  I stream prime movies.  I load movies and take them to faraway places where I connect them to television sets using an hdmi cable and show them.  I watch movies I buy on them.  I purchase from Amazon wirelessly on my Kindle Fire.  I buy and play apps.As a librarian I share information on my Kindle at school, amazing students by swyping on the keyboard.  I pull up photos of giraffes and antelopes in bright crisp colors.  When I model reading with a class I read on my Kindle....and look words up on the dictionary to model that.  The Kindle is always with me at school.When I travel or have an appointment I read quietly in the waiting room or the airport or the car.  The Kindle is always with me away from home.Amazingly, the battery life has never been an issue.  I charge it where I can and it is usually ready for me when I need it.I have only one complaint.  The location of the micro usb for charging.  It is near impossible to stand the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 up and charge it simultaneously.  Even on a soft surface like an ottoman (where I put it while I am streaming movies and knitting, while wearing Bose headphones with my husband only yards away blaring sports on the damned tv) the Kindle Fire falls over or slides.  And I am using the made for Kindle Fire leather cover.  I don't know where the plug SHOULD be but I do know where it SHOULDN'T be...and that is on the bottom when the Kindle is in landscape mode.I love my Kindle Fire HD 8.9.  I will certainly buy the "next" model and pass this one down because that is what kind grannies do. But I hope the next model will have figured out where that micro usb should be located....
Reviews.Title: Reflections on my kindle fire hd 8.0"

Reviews.Author: Mark Bickham "Dillannj"
Reviews.Content: This unit is actually very nice looking. The display is crisp and clear, especially while viewing movies, etc. The best part of this unit for me is the sound: It's really pretty awesome.Pros:Great Display.Awesome sound.Easy to navigate.Seems to have long battery life.Charges quick.Cons:Typing is cumbersome and slow. I was amazed at how easy it is to type on my iPad vs the Kindle. I'm a writer and was hoping to use it for stories and journaling, but that won't work for me. (This is my experience). The bar with matching words or similar words that pops up causes all words typed to be underlined... this also prevents the space bar from registering sometimes, which is a real handicap for a fast writer.The unit also "sometimes" won't load content. I restart it and it works fine, but it's still annoying when it happens.Overall, I like it and have no regrets thus far.
Reviews.Title: 8.9", Wifi, 32 GB, without Special Offers.

Reviews.Author: TartanCat "indiasbelly"
Reviews.Content: I had an OLD kindle and decided that I had finally had it with the clumsy chapter navigation.  I use my Kindle as my primary reading source and the old chapter navigation was driving me bonkers - especially when reading a reference book where jumping around is pretty useful.I have a tablet PC, but it's not easy to access your books and videos from Amazon that way.  I am a software developer and very comfortable with computers, but nobody wants to see that you need to update something before you can sit down and read a book or watch a video.  Still, I really didn't think I'd be using the Fire for anything but books because I had my tablet.Wrong.  I use my Fire all the time.  For books, videos, games, surfing the web before bed.  Love it so much.Highlights for me:- Navigation on the device itself (between books, videos, games, etc) is very intuitive and easy.  You can move through the categories or choose something from the list of recently accessed items.  Very user friendly interface to learn and re-use.- The chapter navigation in all of the books I have tried is improved immensely.  It makes using my Fire for reference books easy.  And when I forget what happened a couple of chapters ago in a novel, skipping back very quickly to remind myself is easy.- Streaming videos from Amazon Prime in bed with headphones while my husband is asleep lets me catch up on "Me TV" without waking the baby in the next room or him.- Swype on the onscreen keyboard.  Typing on any smartphone/tablet style device without Swype is just plain silly.  Swype makes it so fast and so easy.  Love Swype.  Love, love, love Swype.- Web surfing anywhere in the house just got a lot easier.  My tablet gets hot and it feels less portable/more breakable for some reason.  If I just want to surf, the Fire is ready, willing, portable and fast!Cons (so far):- Sometimes the browser gets stuck and has to be closed and reopened.- Amazon should really include the AC adapter for what they call "fast" charging and what I call "normal" charging.  It's only $10, but it's just silly it isn't standard equipment.- I wish the headphone jack and mini USB port were easier to find in the dark.
Reviews.Title: Absurdly in love with my new Fire

Reviews.Author: Harperblue
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire provides everything I need in a tablet and then some.  It is a fantastic bit of technology, with the clarity, vividness and sound being top notch.  One of my favorite things is Kindle Time for kids.  Great way for kids to enjoy the tab while giving parents peace of mind that they will not get into anything they shouldn't.  For three bucks a month you have a boat load of things to choose from for kids.  Books, videos, learning apps.  Very cute how it says "Suzie's Kindle", when you sign into Kindle Time.  I purchased the Fire with "special offers", and I gotta tell you, it was well worth the discount.  It is not intrusive at all.  The special offers only appear when the tab hibernates.  Look, why would you want to pay the crazy prices that other company charges? Standing in line overnight to pay exhorbitant prices just to say "look, I got the latest blank", just isn't my thing. And by the way, I used that other tab for 6 months and got rid of it.  So I can't be accused of talking about something without having tried it.  Bottom line...Amazon has the better product for the best price.
Reviews.Title: Apple Who?

Reviews.Author: Carol Dooms
Reviews.Content: I like how i can do so many things with it. Amazon has been very helpfui with any questions i have had.
Reviews.Title: My Kindel Fire HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: Patricia E. Small "mimi"
Reviews.Content: the larger screen for browsing is much easier on the eyes than my original kindle. The HD graphics makes for a more enjoyable game play
Reviews.Title: brother loves it

Reviews.Author: gongshi Zhang
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, it is much more better than ipad or ipad mini for someone who is getting tired of the ipad series. First of all, it impressed me when I first opened the box. It's black but looks really good. Don't forget the price. You paid the money less than an ipad mini and gains the experience as much as an ipad 4. So far, I am satisfied with everything about it.
Reviews.Title: Great product

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I own a Kindle DX, Kindle keyboard, Kindle Fire, Kindle Fire HD and an iPad first gen.I'm not going to do an indepth review because so many others have. I believe it's sufficient to say that the Kindle Fire HD compares favorably to the iPad in most ways. The added advantage of Amazon Prime makes owning this little gem very easy. I can do nearly everything with the Fire that the iPad can do. I like them both, but the Kindle Fire is my favorite for reading, apps, games and movies.edit 30 days later;Just one crazy thing about this tablet, the front facing camera is awkward. I can't take a photo in front of me at all. Plus the software doesn't come with it. This quirk didn't occur to me initially because I have the iPad 1st gen which has no camera, so I didn't think of it.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Author: ashley
Reviews.Content: I'll say it again, love love love.  It really does have as good of a resolution as the Ipad with retina, but I honestly believe it's much better.
Reviews.Title: Love love love

Reviews.Author: Plainfield317
Reviews.Content: I bought this having only had experience with an ipad 2nd generation. I believe the screen resolution on the fire is equal. The sound is better. I agree that the placement of the power button is not ideal. I accidentally turned it off a couple times. Maybe a portfolio case will help me not to do that. Not any reason to avoid this device. I also agree that a camera that faces both directions would be ideal. I don't want to take pictures of myself. But, this is a super convenient way to Skype. Recently figured out how to get all my music on cloud player. Found a ton of free apps. Most of all, the screen functions well for reading books. It is as easy to set screen preferences on the Fire as the ipad. Change for reading in the dark, enlarge print, easy peasy. I think that for the price this is a big value. They will get me to spend money here, which is why the kindle is more affordable than other devices. But, Amazon has things that interest me. Obtaining content is effortless.
Reviews.Title: Pleased

Reviews.Author: Mrs. Henry A. Dyson
Reviews.Content: WOW! Kindle Fire exceeded my expectation! Wonderful! I love the books and the Bible commentary I purchased, the games, the music  and when I get on line for the News I love that also. I highly reccomend it for any age. I am a very senior citiszen and I love it.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire

Reviews.Author: Eileen Leon
Reviews.Content: Completely captivated with the best Christmas present ever, the Kindle Fire HD.Can do most anything that my desktop computer can do,and in many cases,do it faster and better.Along with its countless practical applications comes a whole lot of FUN !
Reviews.Title: I'M FIRED UP!

Reviews.Author: M Dunsmore
Reviews.Content: When viewing the different Kindle's available, I wanted one of the cheaper ones. My husband talked me into this one and I'm so happy he did. As for the ads, I've found them helpful and they are not the least annoying at all. I'm also not a tech person whatsoever but am able to manage the operations without reading the manual. Also, make sure you get the fast charger, you'll be glad you did plus it's only $9 if you purchase at the same time.
Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle

Reviews.Author: Lois L. Jezek "jezzika"
Reviews.Content: DEAR AMAZON YOU HAVE OUTDONE YOURSELF. THE KINDLE FIRE HD IS SO FAR BEYOND WHERE YOUWERE AND WHAT WAS PROVIDED... THIS IS JUST GREAT... THE COLOR, SHARPNESS EASE OF USE,THE RESOLUTION OF THE PRINTED PAGES AS WELL AS THE CLARITY OF THE GREAT SCREEN TAKESYOUR BREATH AWAY... YES WE HAVE IPADS, BUT THIS FOR MY HUSBAND IS PERFECT...  HE LOVESYOUR BOOK SELECTION AND VARIETY OFFERED BY AMAZON AND WE MADE THE MOVE FROM B&N...;THEY ARE GREAT AND HAVE DONE WELL...BUT YOU HAVE IT ALL... WELL ORGANIZED AND TERRIFIC.THANKS, AMAZON.
Reviews.Title: A REAL WINNER!!!! THANKS AMAZON!!!

Reviews.Author: M. Bailey "mom of 5"
Reviews.Content: I was not sure about making the purchase of the Kindle Fire due to a number of people who seem to dislike this tablet. I am so happy that I ended up buying it. I have a son with special needs who loves playing games on the ipad (used at the hospital he stayed at), but I didn't have the money for one. I thought that since most of the games he likes can be downloaded that we would see how much he liked playing on this Fire. What a great little machine it is! The games work very well. So far we have not had any issues with download anything and the apps are so colorful. Now my only problems is trying to pull it away from him long enough to enjoy it myself. I would like to note that we don't own an ipad or any other tablet other then the Kindle Touch, so it is hard for me to say how much better one is over the other. I also opted to get the plug-in for the outlet to charge with over just using the USB port. I also do not mind the ads, they aren't that much of a bother. If you are on the fence as to buying or not, if you know you like the use of a tablet then I don't think you can go wrong with this Kindle Fire for the price!
Reviews.Title: Wonderful Tablet

Reviews.Author: Charles R. Boddy
Reviews.Content: The new kindle fire hd 8.9 has great resolution at a great price..i would recommend this..the bigger size screen is definately worth the extra price
Reviews.Title: Beautiful resolution and a great price

Reviews.Author: Jamie Brown
Reviews.Content: I did my homework before finally breaking down and buying a Kindle. I am incredibly pleased with the speed, user interface, functionality, graphics and sound! This little guy is awesome - I highly recommend it to anyone searching for a tablet who doesn't want to spend a load of $ but still wants the convenience of a computer/laptop replacement to-go.
Reviews.Title: Excellent Choice

Reviews.Author: Supermom3
Reviews.Content: I love the large screen. We have (2) 7 in and (1) 8.9.I will say that after 45 days the 8.9 HD stopped taking a charge. I called Amazon and they sent me another that day. Excellent service. The reason it stopped charging no know cause. I recieved the new one within days. Thank You Amazon<<<<<
Reviews.Title: Bought for my husband.

Reviews.Author: dallasgirl67
Reviews.Content: This is my third kindle. I started with the kindle keyboard, purchased a kindle fire in November of 2011 and today I received my fire 8.9 HD. I am very happy with all my kindles and highly recommend them to anyone looking to purchase a tablet.
Reviews.Title: kindle love

Reviews.Author: manuel
Reviews.Content: I bought it for $269 ($30 V-Day discount). I had owned a Nexus 10 which although has the larger screen (and feels faster) the price of $400 just does not compare.  Saved me a ton of money for pretty much the same Android experience.  And with Amazon's easy integration and specially with Amazon Prime it is easy to love this device all the way around.
Reviews.Title: Absolutely love it.

Reviews.Author: Alexis
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle Fire HD (8.9" Wi-fi, 16 GB, without special offers) as a gift in December 2012. After one month of use, the entire unit died. As we all know, the KF HD does not come with a normal power charger, just a USB, so when I contacted Amazon customer service, they offered to send me the Powerfast charger for free ($30 value). They suggested that it was a problem with charging the unit, and if this did not resolve the issue then they would send me a new device.As I had a feeling it wouldn't work, but didn't mind getting a free charger, I waited 2 days to receive it and charged the Kindle for about 6-8 hours. Still nothing.Customer service sent me a replacement model very quickly. I am now using the new device but I am a little doubtful as to the quality and longevity of this product. Fortunately, all of my apps were saved in the Cloud so it was pretty easy to restore the device. A little more annoying was having to configure all of my settings all over again.+1 for Amazon's quick turnaround on replacing the item. And I really like the device itself, though it took a while to get used to navigating through it and the swype typing (which I LOVE). I also received a stylus which has been very useful.Hopefully this unit lasts a little longer!!
Reviews.Title: Kindle died after 1 month of use

Reviews.Author: Sonia Johnson
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle for the ease it gives me in carrying around what im reading. It fits in my handbag easily and in the leather case it is protected from scratching. I have still yet to download songs and videos or use the skype features. If you are a book worm this is a great buy and the size is good and the quality and clarity of the pictures are fantastic.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"

Reviews.Author: Mags
Reviews.Content: I got the Kindle Fire HD for my son for Christmas and it has more than exceded my expectations for it.  I have a first generation Ipad and am thinking of replacing it with the Kindle Fire HD.  I had gotten my daughter-in-law a Kindle a few years ago and she carries it in her purse everywhere she goes and he use to make fun of her now she teases him about not being able to part with his Kindle HD.  Thanks for having such a great product for a reasonable price it sure made this Christmas bright for my son.
Reviews.Title: A perfect gift

Reviews.Author: Doris Jones
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is awesome -- I can't get anything done because I'm having fun with Kindle!!  Love it.
Reviews.Title: Love It!!

Reviews.Author: D. R. Clark
Reviews.Content: Great display, easy to use.  We're still exploring possible uses, but so far everything works beautifully. I've streamed a couple of free movies with Amazon Prime.  Lost the signal once but with all the systems in the channel it is surprising that it only happened once.  Deliberately stopped and restarted a couple of times and it never missed a beat.  My wife and I are reading the same book on this and on the older Kindle and the system doesn't get us mixed up.
Reviews.Title: Super product

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I just got my kindle fire hd and I must say I LOVE IT!  So easy to use and has all the features of a tablet.  Sound is great,screen resolution excellent... this is the best buy I have made in a long time!
Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!

Reviews.Author: Scott Parry
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would want a  E -Reader until I bought one for my girlfriend last year,(7" kindle fire) after seeing everything you could do with it I bought myself one (8.9" fire hd) and one for each of my daughters (7" fire hds),I use mine every day ,it is the best thing I bought for myself in a long time,I am writing this review on it right now. My girls use them all the time they skyp me every night when they're at their mom's house.they only thing I don't like is that it does not have a front facing camera and flash.
Reviews.Title: Not much of a book reader

Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: I like my kindle and for the most part it does nearly everything I want it to do. The only problems I have is that the ads are a bit tricky and yes the kindle does offer 250 mb of data for $50.00 but only for the first year, it's more like a trial than anything else, and I was hoping that on this kindle that a flash drive could be plugged in to make working on a document for school or work easier.
Reviews.Title: Great Product

Reviews.Author: Marsha Hirsch "Avid Reader"
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a trip and found the Kindle to be great. Big enough and little enough. I am a mac user and debated about the iPad mini or this. For reading the mini would be great, but watching a movie? The Kindle Fire fits in my purse, does practically everything else.I have one complaint. I wish it came with a user's guide. I am having to find things on my own or ask my children. I am a senior citizen and "easy" should have been included.
Reviews.Title: I am having a Great time!

Reviews.Author: Sharon Hoyer
Reviews.Content: I couldn't decide between an Ipad or Kindle fire 8.9.Have to say I really love the Kindle Fire, great product for the money. I love being able to stream movies.I have a Mac computer, and iPhone so was not sure if I would be satisfied with a Kindle Fire, but I am more than happy.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: Roger Wright Jr. "brian fontana"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS THING! It's faster than my friends iPad2 or mini. The hd screen dis awesome for netflix , YouTube etc. There are tons of free or really cheap books always available and I'm very picky when it comes to books so if I can find stuff that I like anyone can.Cons- The micro usb charge port is horrible. I've had to replace my original kindle and the new one due to it. It's a very commonly used port lots of cell phones ,gameboys have it etc. It's awful and antiquated on those too.I wish there were more apps available and when Google play or the Apple istore add a new app it can take months for the kindle Amazon store to get it. Sometimes they never get it.Otherwise I d rather have this product over the iPad.
Reviews.Title: It's great.

Reviews.Author: C. Glenn "CGlenn"
Reviews.Content: I just got my Kinode Fire HD 8.9 today. I must say I'm impressed! It sounds and looks amazing. easy to use with lots of nice features. makes having Amazon Prime 10x better, with the free monthly book and prime movies. plus it didn't cost 500 bucks. The only draw back is the lack of an expansion slot for adding more memory.
Reviews.Title: Amazing!!

Reviews.Author: mciurej "mciurej"
Reviews.Content: My husband talked me into getting the Fire after watching me struggle to use a flashlight with my original Kindle Paper White.  I hesitated because of the cost but I am so glad he pushed me to get it.  I use it constantly!!!  I can read, shop, surf the web, play games or watch movies.  The picture quality is awesome, everytime I watch something on it my husband ends up leaning over to check it out just because of the excellent picture that it has.  If you are on the fence about getting one jump off and buy it now!!!  You won't regret the purchase!!!
Reviews.Title: Love it, Love it, Love It!!!!

Reviews.Author: JoAnne Kerr
Reviews.Content: I had purchased the original Kindle Fire in November 2011 and was very happy with it.  I was able to get a lot of free apps that made it easy to go online and could easily get my email from various email addresses.  Then they came out with the kindle 8.9 inch hd.  I decided to upgrade to this unit as I had a little problem reading somethings on the 7".  This new upgrade is fabulous!!  The resolution is as terrific as Amazon is claiming it is.  The dual antennas were a great idea.  I have wireless N in my home and was able to get 63 mbs with the original Kindle Fire and that was pretty good, just a little longer bringing up a web page, but now with this kindlle with dual antennas, I am now getting 117 and often times 130 mbs.!!!!!  Everything works faster, the upgraded processor is a plus.  I could not see paying $500 plus to get a tablet from Apple when you can get such a great one from Amazon for $200 less.  It was great that all the books and and apps that I had downloaded for my other kindle fire were available so easily from the cloud.  Amazon made it very easy to watch videos on the new kindle if you have amazon prime.  I decided to try it last November and so far the service has been terrific, it really is 2 day delivery, around the holidays it may have been a day more but that is understandable for that time of year.  The only downside I see to it is that a few apps that are available in google play are not yet available on the fire.  I'm hoping more of them will be available in the future.  The videos run very well, by that I mean Amazon instant video and Netflix.  I passed my other kindle fire to my sister and she is enjoying it very much.
Reviews.Title: A terrific Upgrade for the Kindle Fire LIne

Reviews.Author: SueEllen "SueEllen"
Reviews.Content: After a month and a half of use, I am still enjoying the Kindle Fire HD. I've been using it for reading, watching movies, playing games, email, social sites, and internet surfing. I have been pleased with all of my previous Kindle purchases, and the Fire HD is no exception.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9 HD 32G review after 6 weeks of use

Reviews.Author: Grammy M
Reviews.Content: I was first time buyer for refurbished product but very impressed with quality and it even came in original box.  Thls Kindle Fire HD is more power then what I was going to buy at higher price, and  well worth the price.  I was also able to buy a good cover and new charger, and get all for about  price of new 16HD I was considering.  Thanks for showing used products when applicable.
Reviews.Title: Refurbished Electronics Great Value

Reviews.Author: Drider
Reviews.Content: This thing is probibly the best tech gadget that we have purchased.  My wife loves it.  I looked and looked, read the reviews and most of all I trust Amazon.  After we had it for roughly two weeks, we noticed a small hairline crack in the screen.  Im sure it wasnt there when we first bought it, and it hadnt been dropped.  I was really disappointed.  But after a quick 5 minute call to Amazon they shipped a new one, which we received two days later, and we were back in buisness.  The new one has been flawless.  I have the smaller HD version and I love it.  I wont say it replaces my computer, but I will say i use my laptop about 70 % less
Reviews.Title: Lots of fun in a little package

Reviews.Author: nonpareil
Reviews.Content: I actually really, really love this thing but am finding - to my surprise - that software decisions apparently made at Amazon show (IMO) poor judgment. For example, I have had to "bother" Amazon tech support to get their very stupid auto-correct turned off. At first I couldn't even figure out why everything I typed was being morphed into something unintelligible. Then I noticed... you will realize that I am older, have come into the age of computers from the days of kerosene lanterns and outhouses. Well, in that I am not the Lone Ranger.If I had hours to read online instructions, I might have found how to fix that problem without bothering Amazon techs, but I don't have those hours. Again, I am not the Lone Ranger in that.I did manage to get my email set up by myself but cannot access my drafts folders on the Kindle. Tech told me they are working on that issue. Hope so; otherwise I can't do needed work from the Kindle. One-click payment as set up on the Kindle is not satisfactory as it does not show the total at check-out. Turns out you have to use your regular computer to turn that off. 'Nother call to tech support. There is no way to turn on video subtitles. Tech support told me I need to download an "app" for that but was unable to tell me which one would provide subtitle capability and whether it would be free. I use subtitles even to understand British English as across-the-pond actors so often swallow their words.But here's the thing: This device is absolutely fabulous despite these frustrations. And Amazon appears to be constantly working to improve it and claims to be listening to customer feedback. I suspect they really are. So I will take the extra time to communicate. And Amazon's tech support is the best ever!!! That alone ensures my continued existence as an enthusiastic Amazon money-spender.The picture is To Die For. Sound is crappy (of course - what can you expect?) but I use headphones - easy enough and then really, really good. Features are amazing for the money. I especially like the new Amazon "Auto-Rip" feature that has delivered both music and video without me asking or having to figure out how. If content gets too large for existing memory (inability to do later memory upgrades is unwise engineering decision, IMO), I can simply delete because it still exists in this unseen Cloud. All this is truly amazing and wonderful on my first-ever e-reader.
Reviews.Title: Wonderful with issues.

Reviews.Author: Jason Caldwell
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is a superb tablet. The interface is slick, easy to use and understand, even for non-tech family members. The new HD sound and video really look great watching Netflix or Amazon Prime. I was a little concerned about the prevalence of the ads as I chose not to spend the extra at that time to remove them. I don't think that I will. They are unobtrusively on the lock screen and that is it. Sometimes the ads are even worthwhile.There is a front facing camera which takes some decent photos and now that Amazon Cloud has integrated photo sharing as well will be a great tool for viewing those as well. Battery life is decent considering the amount of reading and watching I do on mine. You will not be disappointed with this tablet choice.
Reviews.Title: Everything I was looking for in a tablet

Reviews.Author: gkk2001
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the 7" monitor of the first edition Kindle Fire. The difference was well worth it.I can read the screen more easily due to larger size and much improved resolution. Sound quality is outstanding.I recommend to buy the Kindle dedicated leather holder, that was also well worth the investment.
Reviews.Title: Simply the best Kindle yet.

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: Beautiful screen, fast internet browsing, easy on the eyes to read with and love Amazon Prime to access all kinds of great TV shows for free! Battery life is amazing too btw!
Reviews.Title: My fav new toy!

Reviews.Author: Ernest J. Grassey
Reviews.Content: Once you learn how it works vs a lap or desktop, it is a pleasant subsitiute for a more bulky computer to take on trips, or away from home or office.  The larger screen gives me more comfort than a phone trying to do the same function.  All in all, a space saving and convenient item.
Reviews.Title: Like a laptop !

Reviews.Author: KindleLover
Reviews.Content: Where would I be without my Kindle? The screen size is perfect, it's not too heavy, sound quality is great. Limited apps for viewing shows you missed on TV.
Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE it

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I take my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 with me everywhere I go.  It fits easily in my purse, and the display and graphics are amazing.  Far exceeds my expectations as far as the way it  performs.  Already loaded with books, games and my favorite app-Out of Milk
Reviews.Title: This is Awesome

Reviews.Author: Tom Roth
Reviews.Content: Awesome tool.I have just scratched the surface of what this is capable of.  What are you waiting for; buy this.
Reviews.Title: Buy It

Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT, LOVE IT, LOVE IT, Did I mention that I love it,, if you are in the market for a tablet this is the one you want, it does everything....
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 4G

Reviews.Author: Susan Oeffner
Reviews.Content: I love, love my Kindle HD 8.9.  The graphics are awesome, bright and clear.  The sound quality, when I watch movies is amazing for such a small item.I play games all day long and enjoy books, magazines, movies, shopping.I'm very pleased!
Reviews.Title: Verry happy

Reviews.Author: William Krause
Reviews.Content: If you think like me you have two questions, is the device good for reading pdfs and is it worth the price? The answer on both counts is yes. The screen is large enough to read around 75% of the pdfs I load in portrait and the rest can be comfortably read in landscape. The screen is of a high enough resolution that the text is easy to read and is an improvement over most computer screens.As a student I have to read a lot of pdf's. Rather than print out hundreds of pages or read the pdf's on my laptop's less than HD screen, I can easily load them onto my kindle. You can also save a lot of money on textbooks if you look in the right areas. Tablets should be for reading and movie watching, both of which this device does extremely well. If you want flawless functionality beyond that, you're probably better off just getting a netbook. This computer will not replace your laptop if you're looking to travel light, nor should it at this price point.I have one problem with the pdf functionality. Sometimes I will load a book in pdf format for which the text is too small in portrait. When I switch to landscape the text is too large. I would like to be able to zoom out to a more comfortable zoom even if that means bank space on the margins.
Reviews.Title: Student

Reviews.Author: Clary
Reviews.Content: This tablet was suggested by a relative and I am so happy I got it.  I love the tablet so much that I got another smaller kindle tablet for my grandaughter (Kindle Fire 7) . I highly recommend it!
Reviews.Title: Love this Kindle Fire HD!

Reviews.Author: happy feet
Reviews.Content: I love this Kindle Fire.  It works flawlessly.  I use it for personal and school use.  I am able to browse and read my textbooks with complete ease and great speed.  Amazon's Silk android based browser is very very good and I love the interface.  It is up and running in less than five minutes from the time you take it out of the box.
Reviews.Title: Absolutely wonderful tablet for the price! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Author: A. A. Walker
Reviews.Content: Compare to the iPad 4 this is a very great deal. Only issue I have so far is the web browser locks up when I come back after a while. I found that if you close the browser completely before you plan to go away for a while the kindle will not lock up.
Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!

Reviews.Author: Chicago Sam
Reviews.Content: I've had my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" for a little more than a month and I must say it exceeded my expectations by a mile!  I have the original Kindle Fire, and while I love it, it was not a replacement for my iPad.  However, since I received my KF 8.9 I have only picked up my iPad when dusting.Perhaps I feel this way because I am completely immersed in Amazon content, but as a multi-media tablet, it blows the iPad out of the water.  It is very easy to navigate and has excellent screen resolution.  I uploaded all of my music to the Amazon cloud and now my KF 8.9 has made iTunes superfluous. And you get all of that for just over half of what the introductory iPad costs.  I'm glad I went this direction!The only thing I wish were better are the apps available in the app store.
