However, if your illiterate child happens to try and escape Free Time, and obviously doesn't know the pass code, he or she will probably tap the blue writing underneath, which is the friendly offer to reset the Kindle back to its factory settings.  Also--it's basically impossible to install Scrabble, for some reason.
Reviews.Title: But...some issues with free time

Reviews.Author: Marcy Ann Alexander
Reviews.Content: so far its everything the best reviews said it was......movies have a good picture and the sound is amazing....still finding things and figuring it out but so far a great buy....he gave me an iPad mini for Christmas but we use these devices for entirely different reasons and his fits him perfectly....wouldnt mind having one myself....the screen size is nice...not too big and not too small..get a case...makes holding it much easier
Reviews.Title: Bought it as a gift for my husband

Reviews.Author: Baxterlf "baxterlf"
Reviews.Content: This has surpassed my expectations. I had the first generation 7" Fire and was happy with it but it had some short comings. All of those are now fixed with this device. The screen is greatly improved. The swipe keyboard is wonderful and now has predictions. The web browser is faster and smoother. All the Amazon features are improved and work seamlessly. Everyone is blown away when they try it out. I appreciate Amazon allowing side loading of apps and it is easily done. The email is tremendously improved and now includes calendar integration built in. So glad customer feedback was listened to.
Reviews.Title: Fixed all my issues with First Gen Fire

Reviews.Author: Linda P.
Reviews.Content: I love the size of it, the ease of use, the number of free items that I can download and the number of applications it has.
Reviews.Title: I like it a lot more than I thought I would.

Reviews.Author: B. Tiscia
Reviews.Content: Present from  my husband. Cant put it down.  Color and screen are beautiful. I can sit in any room with it and get excellent WiFi. Love playing games on it. So much more reasonable than an Ipad .
Reviews.Title: Having a great time!

Reviews.Author: Treva
Reviews.Content: Love it, Love it, Love it.  Received the Kindle Fire HD from my family for a Christmas present this year and was just over joyed.  I really didn't think I would get one as I have a Kindle with the keyboard already.  But the Fire HD is fantastic so far.  Received a one month free trial of Amazon Prime and I have been taking advantage of this service and will most likely sign up for this service at the end of my trial period.  I just stick it in my purse and go.  This is the greatest invention since the light bulb.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Author: cindyr
Reviews.Content: I love the graphics & clear picture of it. Still learning how to use. Wish it came with a paper instruction manual, to look at while using it.
Reviews.Title: Love my kindle fire

Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: It does everything!  The display is simply amazing!  Audio is very good for a tablet as well!Only things I can knock it on are:-Not as many apps as my Android phone-My android phone also has a better cameraOverall extremely pleased though!
Reviews.Title: love this thing!

Reviews.Author: Mohamed K. Alkhalifa
Reviews.Content: I used my 1 st kindle to download my favorite books but with the all new kindle fire which is a must for me
Reviews.Title: My 2nd kindle

Reviews.Author: Wanda Asire
Reviews.Content: One thing I would liketo ask.  It says on a black card included: "Connect the opposite end of the USB charging cable to a Kindle Powerfast accelerated charging accessory (sold separately).  I have one for the plain Kindle I have, can I use that one?
Reviews.Title: the powerfast accelerated charging accessory.

Reviews.Author: Ralph Chapman "Tech Boy"
Reviews.Content: I will not get as techinal as others have, but I will say the speed and quality live up to all the positive reviews.  We have only had ours for a week now but love it so much.  Decided to get one when using my brother-in-law's over Thanksgiving.  Very clean design and good quality parts.  The sound is excellent  and the picture quality is increadable.  No troubles connecting with our wi-fi and downloading all the new contents, updates, and games.  Love the responce time of the touch screen and havn't had any problems with it.
Reviews.Title: One word, WOW!

Reviews.Author: Dennis Jeff
Reviews.Content: The Kindle meets all my expections and is fun to use. The screen is very clear and bright plus the sound is very good.
Reviews.Title: Kindle HD Review

Reviews.Author: MSHusker
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD was a great purchase.  The clarity and crispness of the color is amazing which enhances my experience when reading magazines purchased on the Kindle.  The 64 GB storage will support my book and magazine habit for a long time.  The 4G connection works great and you cannot beat the price.  I did find it a little confusing to get the wireless started but there are several good user's guides out there for $2.99 or less - Some are free with Amazon Prime.  The touch screen still smears up on a regular basis, so I wipe it down with cloth regularly - a small inconvenience to deal with for such a great product.
Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9"

Reviews.Author: Suezy Smith
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my husband for Christmas.  He is not a computer person but loves the Kindle.  He will like it even better when you plays games on it.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire

Reviews.Author: Shannon M.
Reviews.Content: I got this as a Christmas gift for my Mom, who is not computer savvy at all.  She has figured out how to use it with ease & loves it!  She kept telling me she wouldn't like one, but I knew she would if she'd take the time to play around w/ it & I was right.I only bought the 16 GB model & was worried about how quick she'd fill it up.  So far, she's downloaded several books & has only used about 13 MB of space on the Kindle - this also includes a few apps that I downloaded for her.My parents have an unsecured wifi connection set up at their house & it connected w/ ease, no issues what-so-ever, as it did at my house w/ a secured connection.With that being said, I personally have the iPad 3.  As far as I'm concerned I wouldn't trade my iPad for a Kindle... ever! (Hence the 4 * rating.)  I feel like my iPad is much more responsive (screen, touch) & faster (wifi) & way more apps available.  I have the Kindle app on my iPad also, so I'm still able to download & read books if I want.  The Kindle Fire is, obviously, geared more towards avid readers, which I am not.  So, if you're a reader, I think you'll love the Kindle Fire HD, but if you want to be able to do a lot more on a tablet (& can afford it), I would recommend the iPad.
Reviews.Title: My Mom Loves It!

Reviews.Author: patriot
Reviews.Content: I had the original kindle to read my books on. The kindle fire has a light built in, so I dont have to attach a light to read in the dark. To be able to search the internet. I Like the carousel feature. The colors are very vivid. I haven't watched movies on it, yet but Im basically a reader, thats what I bought it for.
Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire!! Color and lighting is great

Reviews.Author: lonnabuy
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my husband.  So far so good.  He is enjoying it. blah blah blah blah blah
Reviews.Title: loving it

Reviews.Author: Jim Watts
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect tablet for an older user who has never used a computer before.  It is ready to use right out of the box and easy to learn to use.  The carousel on the home screen and favorites are excellent for ease of use.
Reviews.Title: Excellent choice

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a great product.  Easy to use and fast downloads.  Easy to learn how to get APPs and watch movies, read books.
Reviews.Title: Great product

Reviews.Author: Michael Goudy
Reviews.Content: I love the size of the Kindle Fire HD.  The color is great.The sound is awesome.  It's really like stereo speakers.The only problem I have is that I can't stay connected to mywifi connection sometimes.
Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Author: frances
Reviews.Content: I love the larger screen now the kindle is the right size. adding the camera was great, make it a better one please. give it a port so i can use my wireless card. not every place has wifi. the picture quality is great, more apps please.The draw-back is all the advertizments !!! When I want to buy something I will go to the store !! Stop taking up my screen space with junk I do not want !! I paid for my device and should not have to share it with a bunch of adds.  These few things would make it purrrrfect.
Reviews.Title: awsome

Reviews.Author: kwenbee13
Reviews.Content: Waited months and months for it to come out -- and was so happy when it arrived!!You'll definitely want to buy the 'quick charge' accessory -- as charging through the PC USB port takes FOREVER!!!Great color, easy to navigate.Haven't had a lot of time to play around on it, or watch any shows or movies -- but the color is sharp and I"m sure they will be great once I have enough spare time to sit and watch a movie!Get one!!
Reviews.Title: OMG -- I love it!!

Reviews.Author: kelly block
Reviews.Content: Beautiful display and super easy to use. My sister who is awful at computers loves it so far. Only down side is make sure to buy the wall charger since it does not come with one.
Reviews.Title: Would recommend

Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: I love it...It's amazing!!!!  I enjoy that I can read a book, watch a movie, listen to music or Skype on this model.  However, it would've been nice to have an instruction booklet for this product.  I still don't understand all the functions of my Kindle Fire after using it for a month.
Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD 8.9"

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This a  great tablet for the price, especially with the $50 for 4g per year.the only thing I am waiting for is for some of the apps I would like to have work better but that will come eventually, especially the native mail app could use updating.
Reviews.Title: This is a great tablet, I have iPads and Samsung tablets also

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this kindle for my wife for Christmas.  She hasn't put it down, yet.  She's doing something with it with all of her waking hours.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: E. M. Steele "ernbone"
Reviews.Content: My Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is everything I expected and more...I purchased it to be able to watch movies, do email, play games and especially read...We travel fairly often and I was tired of lugging my laptop and wanted something to answer business email but not do work on...The first movie I watched was 'Casablanca' and it was incredibly sharp...The keypad is large and because I have fat fingers I use a stylus which is not a problem at all...It was this or the iPad...I have friends with iPads and asked them the pros and cons...The wi-fi capability was the deciding factor for me...I also purchased the leather case for it with the magnetic closure which automatically puts it to sleep...Quality product.
Reviews.Title: I love it!!

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The picture quality if absolutely great!! It is way better than my second generation ipad, and for the price, you cannot go wrong. I would definitely buy another kindle over an ipad in the future.
Reviews.Title: Awesome!

Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: Perfect for me.  Learning more each day of its capabilities.  Images are nice and sharp, everything is working as perscribed.  Having lots of fun with it.
Reviews.Title: My Kindle

Reviews.Author: Cynthia Ryan "kindle lover"
Reviews.Content: I love it. This is my 4th kindle. I have purchased several as gifts. The new kindle 8.9 is great. I like the larger size and the dound is great. I am so glad I "upgraded"!
Reviews.Title: kindle fire 8.9

Reviews.Author: George M. Stephens
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire is easy to understand, easy to use, and easy to read. Already had a kindle tablet and enjoyed it, but this is a great improvement.
Reviews.Title: great to use

Reviews.Author: M. Stjames "Crow Passion"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HD 4G LTE model because I thought it would be able to pick up the ATT signal at least as well as my iPhone 5.  Well, it doesn't.  So I'm kinda wishing I had gone with the less expensive wifi version alone.  It was only when I switched out my Comcast internet modum for a newer model which had wifi that I was able to get connected.No denying the HD provides dazzling picture quality.  And I do love my Kindle.  But it's really easy to buy too much stuff to download.  If you don't have iron self-control, stay away from the Kindle.Would I buy it again - Yes, but not the 4G LTE wireless version.
Reviews.Title: The good and the bad

Reviews.Author: E. Allgood "allgoodart"
Reviews.Content: Only had it for three days now and it is great improvement over my previous kindle that I loved alot until I got this one.  The screen size is perfect for us upper middle-aged people.  Be sure to get a touch pen, the power fast charger and a case to make the use of it super easy.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire

Reviews.Author: Blair W. Williams
Reviews.Content: After recently buying my wife the Kindle 7hd, I was unable to use it.  It was in constant use.  So I upgraded to the 8.9.  Both are fantastic tablets.  The only complaint that I have, is that Kindles do not have an instruction manual.  Inclusion of one would make sense and clear up a lot of confusion and frustrations.  Nonetheless, I have no complaints about either Kindle.
Reviews.Title: great kindle

Reviews.Author: Judi
Reviews.Content: I received this Kindle Fire for Christmas.  The previous Christmas I received a regular kindle.  I thought that was great, but having it in color is just great.  Also, for reading since it is backlit, I don't need a light.  I enjoy playing games on this since my prior Kindle was black/white.  I like the larger screen and if you can afford it, I would highly recommend this.
Reviews.Title: Wonderful!

Reviews.Author: Shirley McLain
Reviews.Content: I have been using my Fire a couple of months now. I have really enjoyed it. It is easy to use and the colors are bright and clear. I gave it four stars because of one feature and that is the on and off switch. It has been difficult for me to locate it. I end up turning the reader around and around trying to locate that little button. I would not hesitate to purchase it again but the on and off switch needs improvement.
Reviews.Title: Overall a Great Product

Reviews.Author: robertfetter
Reviews.Content: The only thing additional I would like is a remote shell to access from my other computer. Android is a lot like Linux, so I would expect that.
Reviews.Title: It is a neat device

Reviews.Author: S. McPike
Reviews.Content: Functional device for those interested in staying connected.  Large screen and easy access.  This one is a must for anyone who appreciates something larger and easy to operate.  Kindle's reputation is an assurance to quality.
Reviews.Title: Better than carrying a laptop around!

Reviews.Author: wendyh
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire, I have always loved reading and gaming on my old kindle but being able to watch movies and tv shows is really great too. Picture quality is fantastic, sound is great and I am learning more fun things to do with it everyday.
Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire 8.9"

Reviews.Author: t bear
Reviews.Content: I searched and researched so many different products before purchasing the Kindle Fire 8.9" HD model. For the short period of time that I have had it, I keep  finding more and more uses, things,apps and all around really neat things this Fire can do. I was a little leary of buying this, even though I have had an older model Kindle reader with apx. 160 books on it and have never had any issue of function of this product. When I received this unit I carefully unpacked and fired it up. I was so impressed with the functions, HD colors and just general feel of this product, that my main response was, WHY DID I WAIT THIS LONG TO BUY THIS UNIT! I know I have really only scratched the surface of the functions of this and can't wait to discover all.One point that I have to share is that I am a retired Law Enforcement Officer and have gone on to getting my NRA and State certification for firearm instruction. As such I haveto haul around a large laptop case and a digital projection case as well as a large rolling box with a number of firearms for demonstrative purposes. As Iget older this becomes a rather difficult venture. With the Kindle Fire HD, I was able to download the NRA program onto the Kindle and using the proper cable, etc. I now can leave my laptop at home, thereby reducing that weight, my next step is to purchase a hand held projecter, available from Amazon, and further reduce the amount of equiptment. I now can load up and go to locations and use my energy to teaching my students all the proper instruction in safely using, care and feeding of same. Point is, without the Kindle Fire HD, I would properly reduce the number of classes that I perform. Without any doubt, if the reader is thinking of purchasing any other tablet, Ipad or others take a good long look at the 8.9" Kindle and I am sure that this will meet most, if not all. In closing, I want to say Thank you Amazon for your innovations.
Reviews.Title: The best money I ever spent

Reviews.Author: Samuel Mudrak
Reviews.Content: I really like it for reading books as well as reading some of my onlne magazine subscriptions.I highly recommend it.
Reviews.Title: Great Notebook

Reviews.Author: Dolores G. Keshner "book worm"
Reviews.Content: Love it, just the right size. The colores are bright, it's fast when looking up stuff on the Internet; just love it.
Reviews.Title: HD 8.9" Kindle Fire

Reviews.Author: kamarce
Reviews.Content: I waited a long time to decide what I wanted to get.  Either a replacement lap top (newer, faster, lighter) or the smaller media devices.  Since Kindle has good reputation, quality, and support, I took the step with Kindle Fire.  So far so good.  Baby boomer me, with no smart device experience, is enjoying the journey of this new technology.  Thanks!
Reviews.Title: Nice, nice

Reviews.Author: loranda haywood
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet, its better than Ipad 3, the HD movies and tv shows are a perfect picture, it's like i'm watching it at a theater, I love all of my apps. My husband bought me this for christmas after he seen how good it works now he wants one.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: Estela M. Diaz
Reviews.Content: I tested it out then wrapped it for Christmas for my son.  Loved it!  I have the original black and white basic and the Kindle Fire; both have been the most reliable e-reader I have ever had.  I compared the capabilities with other similar HD tablets and this was the best for the money.  Why pay much more for similar tablets..Got it sooner than expected.  Great customer service!!
Reviews.Title: Great Product

Reviews.Author: Judy Vasser
Reviews.Content: I have 3 Kindles.. not the original Kindle, but the one after it with 3g and internet access.  Then I ran on to one at Target for $65 that I purchased for my grandaughter without the 3g or whatever.  Then they came out with the Kindle Fire HD and I ordered it.  We have downloaded movies from Amazon and the grandaughter loves that she can watch her movies in the car.  Love it..
Reviews.Title: Love it

Reviews.Author: Clgood
Reviews.Content: I love this Kindle.  I have watched HD TV shows on it.  Downloaded lots of books and some apps.  I'm still figuring out a few things, but all-in-all it is wonderful!
Reviews.Title: Awesome!

Reviews.Author: louhoy58
Reviews.Content: it is amazing love being able to search anything and relaxing in my chair thanks hubby for a wonderful gift
Reviews.Title: kindle

Reviews.Author: Lauren Fairfield
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of kindle and bought one a few years ago.. the kindle fire is way awesome,. I love that it is in color..
Reviews.Title: Awesome

Reviews.Author: Michael Russell
Reviews.Content: Its everything that I hoped it would be, right size, easy to use and has a great HD picture. PERFECT!
Reviews.Title: Perfect

Reviews.Author: D. Knight "Dee Dee"
Reviews.Content: This replaces last year's Kindle Fire and I enjoy this one so much more. The main reason is the larger display - it's just easier for me to see. But it is also easier to use. I didn't realize that at first, it takes a little while to get used to the changes in the user interface even though they are minor. When you do get used to them you realize it really is easier to use.If you are getting this and are also looking for a great case, I recommend this one: Marware Revolve Portrait and Landscape Standing Case. This is the one I have and I think it is fantastic.
Reviews.Title: I Think This is Great!

Reviews.Author: Neville T. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire HD. my only problem is that I can not purchase anything from the Amazon Apps Store, when I am out of the USA. Apart from that. Great Tablet
Reviews.Title: Great tablet

Reviews.Author: RUBY BERRY
Reviews.Content: This is a nice tablet but the camera feature is too awkward to use. I like the size 8.9 makes it easy to view movies and web content.
Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd

Reviews.Author: Wayne Bradbury
Reviews.Content: My wife likes the Kindle Fire HD, but she hasn't figured  out how to load music or most of her pictures to it since it is registered under my sign-on and my music and her music have different play lists and different favorite singers in them. The Amazon Cloud seems to be pretty trickie to upload songs onto because it can only be under my Amazon Account.She does like playing Scramble and Words with Friends on the Kindle Fire instead of on her Android phone because it is always freezing up in the middle of a game and the Kindle Fire doesn't do that.  She likes reading on it a little better than on her old 7" Kindle too.
Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is nice for my wife

Reviews.Author: Avery L. Hasty
Reviews.Content: I use my kindle fire for emails and checking on amazon orders.I found it much easyer to carry and operate than my laptop.I can be done by the time the laptop fires up.It also works with my skype account.
Reviews.Title: just right for what I'm using it for

Reviews.Author: FranTodd
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews thoroughly before buying.  Our Kindle Fire froze on the boot screen just four months after the one year warranty expired and all Amazon could do is offer us a refurbished Kindle for half the price of a new one if I return the old one.  If you read the reviews this is a repetitive problem for Amazon and they are probably making money hand over fist on the refurbished units.  I love saving money, but when Amazon advertises the cost of a Kindle being much lower than an iPad, you have to factor in the cost of replacement.  I've had an iPad for many years with no problems whatsoever.  Granted, I dislike Apple's OS, but the unit hasn't died on me.Amazon refused to replace my unit, even with a refurbished Kindle, to save face with a customer who has given them business since the day they started.  I'm also done with Amazon.
Reviews.Title: You Get What You Pay For - Kindle Fire died and so has my faith in Amazon

Reviews.Author: Jeramie Coffelt
Reviews.Content: A couple of things, first Flash is NO LONGER SUPPORTED.  They use their own version but it doesnt work worth a dang and you have to do some work around to get flash player to work (Download Dolphin Browser).Also, the touchscreen doesnt seem to work worth a dang.  Perhaps its mine alone but honestly, it is slow to react pretty often.
Reviews.Title: Changes made from the original, not good changes!

Reviews.Author: Merrall G.
Reviews.Content: I've got an iPad (4th-generation), a Kindle Keyboard, a Kindle Paperwhite, and this Kindle Fire HD 8.9" In addition, I've got the Kindle App on my iPad. Of them all, I like the Kindle App on my iPad the best (because it allows outside content to be saved on it, ie not only from Amazon). Apart from that, I like, or dislike, each of the Kindles for different reasons.Since this review is about the Kindle Fire HD 8.9", I'll just refer to the others where it's relevant.Bear in mind that I'm 72, and I'm Australian (with an Australian billing address), and I'm currently in South Korea (where I'll be for a while). Those three pieces of information are relevant to what I have to say.KINDLE FIRE HD 8.9"When I bought my Kindle Fire HD, I was actually on a trip to America. Naively, I thought that - having bought the Kindle Fire HD in America (although using my Australian billing address), I'd be able to download movies, for watching while I'm traveling around (which I do a lot). Moreover, I thought I would be able to join Amazon Prime, and have access to all the thousands of movies, and TV programs, that Prime members can download - just for their $79-per-year subscription. Also, I expected that I'd be able to get access to individual songs, as MP3 downloads.However, despite the fact that, as soon as I got my Kindle Fire HD, I was sent an e-mail from Amazon, telling me all the wonderful things I'd get as a Prime subscriber (including free 2-day shipping) - and giving me a one-month trial to boot - I could not, in fact, be a Prime member.  As soon as I tried to activate Prime, I was told that I was geographically restricted - couldn't even get one-track MP3 downloads. It seems that - to get into the Prime deal - one must have a US billing address, and a US home address.So that was a big disappointment. I was initially so miffed that I thought I'd return the Kindle Fire HD to Amazon, especially since I was still in the US at the time I found I would be subject to geographic restriction. But I kept the Kindle Fire HD because I realized that it was better for a few other functions, than either the Kindle Keyboard, or the Paperwhite.PLUS FACTORS for the Kindle Fire HD 8.9"1) AUDIOBOOKSIt seems that audiobooks don't have geographic restrictions, as movies, TV programs, and music have. So I've bought several audiobooks and, although the speakers aren't really powerful, they are powerful enough, if you are sitting in a quiet room, to hear the book reading very clearly. In addition, it's possible to use a bluetooth speaker, to get louder sound if it's wanted. Since I majored in English Literature - many years ago! - I'm on a mission to listen my way through all of the classics of the English language (which is so much more relaxing, via listening, than doing all that eye-wearing reading, with a hard-to-hold paperback that won't stay open at the pages you want it to). For example, I've just finished listening to "The Great Gatsby" and that was easy listening - except that the reader, Jake Gyllenhaal, wasn't able to project any sort of vocal personality for the all-important females - Daisy in particular. Just listening to Jake Gyllanhaal's effort to "find" a voice for Daisy (unsuccessfully) left me feeling there'd be no way that a listener/reader (who didn't already know the book well) could believe in Gatsby's obsession with a Daisy that the wish-washy unnoticeable voice personality that Jake Gyllenhaal's narration assigned to her.Given that it would surely not be easy for a man to render the voice of a young, upper-class, beautiful temptress, with any subtlety or authenticity, I think Audible should use cheaper unknown actors, so the budget could stretch to both a male and female narrator. What Audible seems to be doing is trying to tempt buyers by hiring big-name actors to do the narration. If Jake Gyllenhaal's no-impact rendition of Daisy is an example of the worth of using famous actors, it's a strategy that could backfire.2) MUSIC VIA THE AMAZON CLOUDAlthough I can't get single-track MP3 downloads, I can get instant music to the Kindle Fire HD, if I buy CDs (with AutoRip). As soon as you pay for those CDs - to be delivered to somewhere (anywhere for CDs - expensive shipping to Korea or Australia, but cheap to a friend in America, especially with free shipping for an order over $25), all of the songs are automatically delivered to your Kindle Fire HD (as well as to your PC, Kindle App, etc.) So I'm very happy with that - I've now got about 17 albums loaded up: everything from Vera Lynn and Frank Sinatra to Jackie Evancho and Josh Groban. As I write now, on my PC, I have "David Foster: Hit Man and Friends" playing in the background (on the Kindle Fire) - a bit away from me, rather than blasting out of the PC in front of me, to distract me.3) GADGET/SOFTWARE INSTRUCTION BOOKS (IN KINDLE FORMAT)Amazon has zillions of instruction books for IT gadgets and software programs: Kindle Fire HD itself, iPad, Android, Dropbox, Evernote, etc. For those sorts of instruction books - which have colored pictures, and screenshots, it's useless trying to learn from them, on a Kindle Keyboard, or Kindle Paperwhite: the pictures, tables, and screenshots don't translate well into black and white format, and the screens are too small to be able to get  "pageful" of text and graphics at the same time. I've never used a Kindle Fire 7", but I'd expect that Kindle to also have a screen which is be too small for these kinds of instructions book. But the screen size of the Kindle Fire HD is perfect for showing pretty much the information (plus graphics) that would fit on the page of a real book - or on the iPad screen.A second advantage of having those gadget/software instruction books on the Kindle Fire HD is that you can keep the "pages" open on the Kindle Fire while you are trying out operations and techniques on, for example, the Kindle App on the iPad, or on the iPad itself. So it's really like having a book beside you.A third advantage is that, if you had those instruction books on an iPad, (for using as a reference book "beside" you, while you learn on another gadget), too much of the iPad charge is being used up to keep the books "open" for long periods of time. (It seems that the iPad gobbles up power a lot faster than the Kindle Fire HD does.) So, if you keep the iPad on its default auto-off setting (2 mins), to save the charge, it keeps turning itself off - unless you are actually touching the screen. The Kindle Fire HD stays "on" better, because there's not such a risk of running out of power too soon, if you leave it set at a higher time period for auto-off (such as 30 mins). Of course, it's possible to set both gadgets to "Never" to keep them on all the time you want that "reference book" open beside you - and I did that once, with the iPad. But I forgot to put it back to "2 mins" when I'd finished. So the iPad stayed on "forever" - presumably keeping a sensor fully employed, checking for Wifi hotspots wherever I went (even though it wouldn't have found many that I could connect to, since I don't have a cell-phone with a Wifi hotspot). The result was that, the next time I went to use the iPad - thinking it was still well charged - it was stone dead! Well, the Kindle Fire HD doesn't run out of charge as fast as the iPad, so it seems safe to leave it set on something like 30 minutes (auto-off) all the time - although it would probably be a good idea to set it back to 5 minutes, when finished using it.4)GOOD FONT/BACKGROUND COLOR OPTION FOR GLARE-SENSITIVE EYESI have eyes that are very sensitive to glare - white glare from screens, and glossy surfaces. The Kindle Fire HD, unfortunately, has a very glossy screen (compared to the Kindle Keyboard, and Kindle Paperwhite). But I've found a very good way to deal with that glare, such that I can comfortably read from the Kindle Fire HD screen. You can choose your default screen colours - with three options: black font on white background; black font on off-white (sort of like the Kindle Keyboard buff color), and white font on black background. I find that, even with the Kindle Fire HD's glossy screen, I can read very comfortably with that white lettering on a black background. It's a great way to reduce all the glare we get from white screens.NEGATIVE FACTORS for the Kindle Fire HD 8.9"1. GEOGRAPHIC RESTRICTION FOR MOVIES, TV PROGRAMS, MP3 MUSIC DOWNLOADS, AND PRIMEOne big negative, for me, was outlined above: with an Australian bill-paying account, I can't download movies, TV programs, or MP3 music tracks - or be a member of Amazon Prime (although on my account screen, I keep getting messages that inform me I should join Prime, to reduce the shipping charges that I'm incurring - to Korea,mostly, and that's definitely not a free 2-day deal).2. KINDLE KEYBOARD AND KINDLE PAPERWHITE BETTER FOR READING LONG BOOKSDespite being able to set the screen for white lettering on a black background, it's nowhere near as comfortable to read lengthy books (such as novels) on the glossy KINDLE FIRE HD screen - and it's quite a bit heavier to hold up. For general book reading, I actually prefer the Kindle Keyboard best of all - with the e-ink off-white background that's not so glary, although it's handy to have back-lighting on the Paperwhite for reading at night, on airplanes.3. CAN'T PLACE YOUR ITEM ICONS WHERE YOU WANT TO PUT THEM, AND MAKE THEM STAY THERE!If you've got a lot of books loaded on to the Kindle Fire HD (and this is also relevant for the iPad Kindle App), you can't make them stay on the Home screen, in some order that suits you. It always happens that, as soon as you access one book, it comes to the top of the heap (so to speak), and so you've lost your grouping of similar kinds of books. In my case, I've got a bunch of RV books, many Instruction books for gadgets, various Travel guides, and Novels, etc. So it annoys the hell out of me when I've gone to the trouble to have all similar books "sitting" arranged beside each other, on the Home screen display. Then, as soon as I access one book, that book comes to the top of the display (or the beginning of the display), and will then end up mixed up with other books that are not in a similar category.Now, compare this with iBooks, on the iPad - which is excellent from this point of view.When you save a book for reading in iBooks, you can hold your finger on the book (or pdf) icon, and then move the icon to wherever you want it to be, in your collection. Subsequently, having placed each icon where you want it to be, it stays there - such that, every time you access that book (or pdf), or any other, the items go back "to bed" at the place on the "bookrack" where you put them. Not only does that allow you to keep all your collections grouped together, but it also facilitates developing a visual memory of where particular books or pdf files are, on the bookshelf - very useful if you've got a large collection of pdf files, and they all look pretty much alike, until you bring them up on to the reading screen where you can read the "cover" print more easily.This feature (or non-feature) is particularly a pain (on the Kindle iPad app), with Lonely Planet pdf files of their guidebooks. Lonely Planet has a few guidebooks as single-file pdf files. But, mostly, they supply the books as a bunch of separate chapters (like mini-books)- without an overall single-file pdf for the books that you've bought. So, just imagine what a mess you can get into with all those individual chapters - especially since the topics of the individual chapters can't easily be read until you bring them up fully on the screen. In addition, for almost all of the guidebooks that come in chapter bundles, the background colors are the same. Each country group of chapters has a unique picture on the cover of every chapter in the collection, but the pictures are small and you can't really see them until you bring a book (a chapter mini-book) up for reading.Consequently, you get a really messy situation because of Kindles (for the iPad app, or stand-alone Kindles)not allowing you to place your books, in the display, where you want them - and where they will return to after use. For instance, if I bring up a chapter of "Nicaragua" (out of perhaps 13 chapters), and then I bring up a chapter of "Columbia", and then one of "Bolivia" and also "Peru" - all of which I've got on my iPad (saved in both the Kindle App, and iBooks) - I end up with all of the chapters totally scrambled in the filing system; that occurs because no one chapter goes back to "its place" among the other chapters for the guidebook that it belongs to.So I have to use up more of my iPad's memory than I'd like, by saving all those chapter pdf files into both places: in iBooks, to keep the chapters where I want them to be "filed"; in the Kindle App, so I can access the contents page, touch on a topic in the contents, and get taken immediately wherever I choose to go. (With iBooks, for the same LP guide books, you can't access the contents page as a list, touch on a topic you want to go to, and be routed instantly to that topic - a very helpful feature of the Kindle App.)4. CAN'T USE THE AMAZON CLOUD TO COPY PDF FILES)FROM THE iPAD KINDLE APP TO THE KINDLE FIRE HD.When I buy those pdf files of guidebooks, from Lonely Planet (and they are not the same as buying Kindle-ized books of LP guidebooks - which are usually awful, with unreadable maps), I can save those pdf files to the Kindle App on the iPad, and that's fine - except for the mini-book chapters not staying where I want them to stay! However, the Amazon Cloud doesn't seem to allow me to then copy those pdf files on to the Kindle Fire HD - where I'd really like to have them.Imagine wandering around the back streets of just about any Latin American city (where I intend to be for some months of next year), with your iPad in your hand for consulting your off-Wifi guidebook. If you're foolish enough to be doing that - particularly an old woman like me - there's a pretty good chance some local desperado will grab the iPad and run. On the other hand, a Kindle Fire HD 8.9" would be a way less attractive trophy for a street-roaming snatcher (one who can tell an iPad from a Kindle Fire HD!); the Kindle Fire HD would also be much lighter for carrying around all day, and consulting; plus, even if the Kindle Fire HD does get grabbed, it's a whole lot cheaper to replace than an iPad.So I'd really like the Amazon Cloud to allow copying of pdf files from my iPad Kindle App, to my Kindle Fire HD. It's probably possible but I can't figure out how to do it. The Amazon Cloud doesn't seem to want to talk to anything not directly bought from Amazon, even if the pdf files are now "in the Amazon system" by virtue of being saved into the Kindle App on the iPad. .Now, here's the point of this for Amazon's bottom line. The Kindle Fire HD, as we all know, was designed to make it easy for all of us to buy Amazon books, audiobooks, movies, etc - although I, with an Australian billing address, can't manage to buy movies, TV programs, MP3 downloads (or join Amazon Prime). We know, and accept, that this gadget was definitely not dreamed up by Amazon, to facilitate open-sourced buying. But you would think that a Kindle App on an iPad would be able to talk to a stand-alone Kindle, via the Amazon Cloud. Seems not - friends only if Apple is the friendship broker.Nevertheless, it seems to me that Amazon could benefit from allowing Lonely Planet pdf files to be transferred, via the Amazon Cloud, to a Kindle Fire HD. Why? Well, as most people have probably discovered, it's nice to do all the travel research on an electronic gadget. But, when it comes to the boots-on-the-ground traveling, nothing beats having an actual dead-tree guidebook - extensively thumbed, and defaced with with notes, stickers on pages, and highlighted text. It's very difficult to have those user-friendly possibilities if you are interacting with any kind of tablet, except for trivialities - such as the best places to sleep or eat.Therefore, allowing Lonely Planet's pdf files to be uploaded on to one's Kindle Fire HD, from an iPad Kindle app, would probably produce sales, from Amazon, of the real books when the travel time comes. Why again? It's way cheaper to buy the actual LP books from Amazon than from Lonely Planet, even if you live in Lonely Planet's country: Australia. For me, the price of buying an LP guidebook, in Australia, is about twice the price that I'd pay from Amazon (with no shipping charge, if I was passing through America, on my way to all those Latin American countries, and had the books delivered to my USA-transit accommodation, before my arrival in America).For example, I made a trip just to San Francisco about three months ago and, despite having some LP chapters, for San Francisco, on my iPad (as pdf files - before my arrival), I still bought two other SF guidebooks, from Amazon, and had them delivered to the place I intended staying at, in SF. Plus, also from Amazon on that SF trip, I bought several real guidebooks for Japan: Tokyo, Kyoto, Walking in Japan, etc.So if Amazon allows the uploading of LP pdf files on to a Kindle Fire HP - as Amazon Cloud transfers from an iPad Kindle Fire app, it doesn't mean that Amazon will go broke supporting non-Amazon booksellers. In fact, by allowing such transfers, it just builds greater customer loyalty to Amazon, and its Kindles - AND it's pretty good advertising if little old ladies, like me, are wandering around Nicaragua, Columbia, Bolivia, Peru, Ecuador, Panama, and Costa Rica - and Japan - with their Kindle Fire HD's constantly on show. Amazon couldn't get that kind of advertising if the company paid for it!Therefore, I think there is a good reason for Amazon not to block pdf files from other publishers - especially from guidebook publishers, such as Lonely Planet, and especially if the pdf files are already in the Amazon system, saved into a Kindle App on an iPad..
Reviews.Title: The icons won't stay where I put them, and the Amazon Cloud sometimes goes missing!

Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is a very good tablet for the price. I quickly bought the first generation Fire upon its release, and it was my first tablet. After using that smaller tablet for over a year, I decided to pick up the larger 8.9 inch HD model. After using it, I must say I actually prefer a smaller, 7 inch tablet. This is not a knock against the Kindle Fire HD 8.9, just a personal preference of mine regarding the size.The Pros:The price is a big selling point, in my opinion. I do not believe you can find another tablet this size for a cheaper price, but I may be wrong.The graphics and resolution are wonderful, and colors are very vibrant!The operating system is a step-up from first generation Kindles, but still not perfect (more on that in a bit).Some areas of content have a great selection! If you want to watch movies on your tablet, this is a great one to have! Amazon has a very good selection of films to rent or buy. And of course, don't forget about books. Amazon's selection of books is unmatched, and purchasing and downloading are very easy. I especially like how Kindles "communicate" between each other. For example, if I stop reading on my Kindle Fire HD, my other Kindle knows where I left off, which makes reading across devices very easy. The fact that all Kindles on an account sync with each other, if you want them to, is very helpful.The Cons:The app store just isn't very good. There are some decent games (my son enjoys many of them) but not anywhere close to the games available for Apple, or even Google Play for that matter. There are even fewer productivity apps, which is a big drawback for me. There also seems to be quite a few cheaply made, low quality bad apps. Because of this, the Fire is essentially a device to consume media on-that's it! If you're wanting to edit video or play around with photos, you'll be disappointed by the Fire.The camera is pretty weak, and is really only for video conferencing.The operating system, as noted elsewhere, is a heavily modified Android (and by heavily modified, I mean basically unrecognizable). I have an Apple phone, and love the iOS. I have never used a straight Android operating system, but only played around with devices. From my very limited experience, I think the unmodified Android is far better than what Amazon gives us on the Fire, and wish they would stop tinkering with it so much.Rumor has it a Kindle Fire HD 2 will be available later in 2013, and upon its release I look forward to seeing what improvements have been made. If enough enhancements have been done, I will most likely buy a 7 inch. While the Kindle Fire is not the best family of tablets, it is a good tablet at a good price that fits perfectly into the Amazon ecosystem of which I am firmly entrenched.
Reviews.Title: A Good Tablet for a Good Price, but Not Without Some Drawbacks

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I have high expectation of this kindle fire hd. I've used it for a few months now, and I feel disappointed. The pros are obvious, I like the high res screen, the amazon content, both books and prime videos. These are big big advantage over the ipad and other tablets, and that's the reason I didn't return it.The CONS are so many, I just list a few I don't like the most:1. low quality apps. not many really useful apps you can find. The app quality is worse. Take skype for example, it always drops connection, and has much lower video quality than my ipad2. my old ipad2 seldom drops connection.2. Web browser app, Silk, is a pain. I don't know how many people really use it to browse the web. It's slow, inefficient. even with its much larger screen, I still prefer browse on my iphone use chrome.3. Even the native kindle book reader app, is not as good as on iOS. Though amazon brag it's audio book sync function, but i don't find that much useful for me. To activate the dictionary, you need to pinpoint your finger right on the words very precisely, I often find myself trying two or three times before get the right words I want to touch. But using Kindle app on iOS, I never had this problem. Guess it's mostly due to the kindle fire operating system amazon stocked.4. Battery life is a pain as well. I didn't tested seriously, but in my impression, it's way worse than ipad2. I used ipad2 more than this kindle fire hd, but charge ipad2 less frequently.5. The audio quality is a selling point when Bezos introduce this kindle fire hd in the keynotes, but I have to say, when watching videos, I always felt the sound is too little and it feels like the sound goes away from me (rather than towards me). Speakers are on the back, maybe that's the reason. But why ipad2 doesn't give me this feeling? I am so confused.All in all, you get what you paid for. It's a very capable ebook reader, and a good device to access amazon's huge content in the cloud. But I won't recommend it if you want a full functional tablet.
Reviews.Title: a ebook reader with tablet function

Reviews.Author: Maimouse "MSC19"
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a replacement for my Galaxy Tablet which after 2 years is finally dying. However, the Verizon plan is expensive and I needed an alternative. as I use my Tablet for reading, GPS and occasional email, I looked into the Kindle. I figured let me just order it as I have a 30 day testing time to return it. I just fell in love. It is large but lightweight. They certainly mean HD as the images are crisper on this than a HD TV. Suffice to say I am keeping it and getting the great AT&T; promotional wireless pricing. I highly suggest this product!!
Reviews.Title: WOW

Reviews.Author: brijeffnel
Reviews.Content: I have the first Kindle Fire version and I like it a lot, so I decided to get the newest version for my mom for her birthday because she does not own a computer but would still like to explore the internet, download books, etc.  The unit itself looks nice and is easy to master, but I could not be more disappointed by the fact that it only came with a USB cable as a charging option.  My original Kindle Fire has a transformer that plugs into the wall, so I just assumed the newest version would have the same.  So my mom used the Kindle when she got home until the battery died but then had no way to charge it!!  She is not at all computer literate, so seeing just the USB cable meant nothing to her so she ended up going to Radio Shack to ask someone how to charge it.  I got the tablet specifically because it was easy to use and did not require computer skills to operate - so I was extremely disappointed to find out that the only option to charge it was on a computer if you didn't already have an adapter.  This is a pretty poor assumption on Amazon's part - I realize most households own a computer, but to sell a product without an option to charge it out of the box is ridiculous.
Reviews.Title: No Charging Option?

Reviews.Author: Jason Brooks
Reviews.Content: The "Silk" browser that come with the Kindle is garbage. You can side load google chrome, but the process is tedious. This would be a five star product if Amazon would loosen up a bit, give us access to google play, and ship the product with a decent browser.  I bought the Kindle because I do most of my online business with Amazon. I'll continue to do business with them, even if I have access to a decent browser on my kindle. So Amazon, lighten up a bit, ok?
Reviews.Title: I want access to google play

Reviews.Author: Aidan Brookman
Reviews.Content: After reading so many asinine 1- and 2-star reviews, I thought I should go ahead and get my review out there. And before anyone has a chance to question it, though this is not a verified purchase, I DO own this device. My folks were kind enough to let me purchase this through my Dad's account, and pay him back over time. But anyhooooo, about the device...The first thing I noticed when I opened the box was how thin the Fire was! The original Fire, though I absolutely love mine, was rather blocky. My new baby was charged up, so I turned it on and checked out the picture. Absolutely freaking beautiful! Before I really played with it, I plugged it in and charged it up. No, a charger was not included with it. But I READ the product description and knew that, so I had already ordered the quick charger, even though I already had other chargers.When it was pretty quickly charged, I got down to some serious playing. I have to admit that I am totally blown away by the beauty of the picture. I don't own any other HD devices, so I was not prepared for just how gorgeous the images would be. I was easily able to explore the Fire, as the quick tutorial explained what was needed to get started. I loaded a number of books, lots of music and apps, and some pictures. I am thrilled that this device can be loaded with my personal pictures. It was extremely easy to do through the cloud. And they look fantastic!I checked out the sound. Dang, Green Day and Pink sounded absolutely awesome coming through the Dolby speakers! No, it doesn't sound like a Bose sound system, but come on....this is a tablet. I think it sounds fabulous. Haven't tried it with headphones yet, but I will.I then played on the reading app. Love it! Though I do most of my reading on my Kindle Keyboard and Paperwhite, it will be very easy to read on this device. Everything was crisp and clear...I especially like the sepia background; it's very easy on the eyes.Now we come to the apps. No, not all of the apps I had on the original Fire would load onto the Fire HD. Nor did I expect them too. And I frankly don't care. If I want to play them, I'll play on the original Fire. Rooting? Side loading? Huh? Nope, don't even want to attempt that. I'm very pleased with the content I can get for my device from Amazon. I bought this tablet for entertainment purposes. And I know as time goes by, more apps will be adapted to work for the Fire HD. The 8.9" screen makes such a huge difference when playing apps. I no longer worry about going blind playing Mahjong on my smaller screen!I then decided to check out some TV episodes I bought. Copper looks fantastic on the HD screen! I also checked a Prime movie - X-ray is such an awesome idea. No more going crazy trying to figure out who is playing a particular role; I just look it up without having to go to the web. Watching movies is truly a beautiful experience on the Fire HD. I haven't used HDMI (did I type that correctly?). I don't have an HD TV. Besides, I like to watch on my 8.9" screen.My Yahoo and Hotmail e-mail accounts were easily set up. I like the e-mail app on the Fire HD better than the one on the original Fire. I went to the browser and put my favorite websites on and bookmarked them. This device is much faster than the Fire. I will admit that the browser locked up and reset a few times. I'm using a stylus, and sometimes I tap more than I should (which I did on the original Fire because I had to). I'm getting used to the screen, though, and it's happening less as time goes by. And I have had tabs not respond; but they recover so quickly, it's a total non-issue for me.I believe Amazon Prime is a MUST if you own this device. Besides the free shipping on millions of items, you WILL want the free Prime TV shows and movies to get the most out of your Fire HD.I highly recommend the Fire HD 8.9" 32GB with no hesitation whatsoever. I mentioned some of the asinine reviews I read and would like to touch on a few points. If you read the product description, you will know what this device can and cannot do. Unless you live under a rock, I don't know how anyone doesn't know that Adobe no longer supports flash and is no longer used on new android devices. And I can't say I know absolutely for sure what flash is, but I know I don't miss it! Same goes for the device not coming with a charger; it's not listed in what comes in the box, and it has been discussed here more than once.. Someone said his Fire HD had sharp edges. Eh? Still trying to figure that one out! The edges of mine are very nicely rounded, thank you very much. There's no forward facing camera! Call me crazy, but if I want to take pictures, I use a camera (or my cell phone if it's a "photo emergency"). Reviews have downgraded the device because of packaging or delivery times. Sorry, but what does that have to do with the performance of the device? There were also the reviews that were not reviews of the Fire HD, but were plugs for their favored Nook or Apple devices. Then there are the defectivebydesign mindless Zombie reviews. No comment. But my favorite bad review was the guy who couldn't stand touchscreen devices. Then why the heck did you order one that you KNEW was a touchscreen device?!?!?!Get one of these babies for yourself and check it out. I think you'll love yours as much as I love mine!
Reviews.Title: A review for the non-techies among us

Reviews.Author: Princess Luna
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent improvement upon Amazon's Generation 1 Kindle Fire. I ordered the 8.9" after my original Kindle messed up in a major way. Before I go into the details about this product, I must give a shout-out to Amazon's customer service team for the excellent way they treated me when my first Kindle messed up. It was almost out of warranty, but they still sent me this particular item at a deep discount. They were very polite about everything, and I got it 2 days later. I am now a loyal Amazon customer.This particular Kindle's screen is bigger and clearer, it has dual speakers on the back, and comes with the option of turning on Dolby Digital Stereo from the Kindle screen's menu. It has volume controls on the side which enable you to change the volume in a hurry if need be or if you don't want to mess up your viewing experience with the drop-down volume screen. By the way, it appears to sound better when laid on a table than when it is being held up. It has dual plug-in ports: an hdmi port and a charger port. The problem I have with this is that they are very similar looking in size. One is just slightly bigger than the other. So please be careful when plugging it into the charger and make sure you use the right one. Overall I am really satisfied with this product.As to small details having to do with customization, the only drawbacks are that this particular model does not support Go Launcher or allow wallpaper apps to work. ADW launcher works just fine however, if you don't care for the carousel-style screen and want something even more tablet-like. It is a bit more delicate than the original first generation so I would be careful about letting a child play around with it. If you have a child and want to get them their first real tablet, I would go with the original 7" Kindle 1st generation. It just seems to be more durable and thicker and seems to be up to the task of being treated slightly rough.
Reviews.Title: Ahhh Yiss

Reviews.Author: Gina M Rollin "Gina R."
Reviews.Content: For anyone who requires screen reading software don't let the "Accessability" of this product lead you on.  It does read some of the menus and you can navigate via a bluetooth keyboard, however be aware that any of the features that require web access are not supported by the Voice Guide system.  Some books are text tpo speech, but make sure what you buy has this feature enabled by the publisher.  If you need a screen reading system, save your cash and buy an iPad.  At least that has Voice designed to work with all features of the product.  It is nice to know the title of the song or book that you are selecting before it opens.  Note to Amazon:  Please train your associates about how the Accessability features on all your Kindle products work.  I hope this review helps anyone else who is looking at purchasing a Kind and has either low or no vision.Thank you.
Reviews.Title: Not for the visually impaired.

Reviews.Author: fitegirl
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HD 8.9. I can watch movies, read books, hook it up to my tv, surf the web, check my email.  The picture is beautiful, great sound.  Easy navigation.  I dont even mind the offers that come up.  LOVE it.
Reviews.Title: Love it

Reviews.Author: Erica
Reviews.Content: It's great.  No complaints from me. If your not a techie person, like me, and all you want is to read a good book, watch a good show or movie, play some games, surf the net, and not spend a fortune on a device . . . then a kindle is perfect for you!
Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle

Reviews.Author: Dawna324
Reviews.Content: I love this Kindle Fire HD 8.9" better than the 7". So far I can't find anything wrong with it.
Reviews.Title: Great Tablet

Reviews.Author: LA
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this product and WOW!  It;s really great! I've watched HBO, listened to Lady Gaga, downloaded great house music and lots more. I don't know what I'd do without it now.
Reviews.Title: incredible!

Reviews.Author: Deborah McGraw
Reviews.Content: I just got this Kindle tablet a week ago so these are just first impressions.  I have a laptop but wanted something easy to carry around for Googling, checking my Gmail, looking at Facebook, and reading.  The Kindle Fire offers all of these things and is cheaper than an IPad so I took the plunge. Here is what I found for those activitiesGoogling - It comes with Bing as the default but I prefer Google (or at least I am most used to it).  It was easy to switch.GMail - This was where I had frustration.  There is a mail app that includes Gmail but I kep getting an error message.  I googled looking for reasons and got the idea that several people have the same problem but still no luck.  Yesterday I decided to try going into gmail by googling Gmail and used the login site.  I had to answer security questions because I was using a different "device" but once I did that, I was in.  Later, I tried the Gmail app and it worked just fine.Facebook - It is easy to get into and works but I am hoping to figure out how to change some of the settings.  As I scroll through the postings, I can't seem to get the movement just right to scroll when I want to and enlarge the pictures when I want to.  I figure as I get more used to touch screen, that will improve.All in all, I think it is working out well for what I want.  I am 71 and figure if I can use it so easily, anyone ca.
Reviews.Title: Beautiful screen, good sound on Kindle Fire HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: Jennifer Webster
Reviews.Content: I waited a long time to buy a tablet, and when I finally did, I did a ton of research.  At the end of the day, I narrowed it down to the KIndle Fire HD and the Nexus 7.  I ended up buying this tablet first, but I ended up also buying the Nexus 7.There are things I love about the Kindle:For media consumption, particularly music and video, the experience is wonderful.  The screen is crisp and clear, and the sound is much much better than I've ever heard from a tablet.  In my own house or a hotel room, I don't necessarily want to have to have headphones in to watch a TV show.But there are a couple of key complaints:This thing is HEAVY.  Reading with it for more than a few minutes is not comfortable.The Amazon app store does have fewer apps than the Apple Store or Google Play, but this is not my biggest complaint.  My biggest complaint about the apps is that many apps that are free in other markets are not free on Amazon.  Even things like Instagram are not free on the Kindle.  So, cost of ownership for this tablet is higher than for other tablets, because the app costs are higher across the board.
Reviews.Title: Ambivalent

Reviews.Author: Duffy
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is a welcomed improvement over the original Kindle Fire since it includes the possibility of viewing streaming video on HD television sets supporting HDMI.  Of course, there are may other improvements including the availability of a fast battery charger and longer lasting battery charge.  While the video and audio quality were excellent, my router's wireless signal strength was too weak for the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" to work in a reliable fashion on my HD set.  A wireless extender solved the signal strength problem.  Of course, the extender requires support from the Kindle Fire HD tablet.  Fortunately, the Kindle Fire HD tablet recognized the extender signal and walked me through the steps required to provide a secure wireless connection of the Kindle Fire HD to my HD television set. The trial Prime subscription service provided an excellent opportunity to test the performance of the Kindle Fire HD video and Dolby Audio signals. Samplings of the Murdock mysteries series confirmed the ability of the Kindle Fire HD to deliver a satisfactory picture and sound to the HD set. Duffy.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 16 GB

Reviews.Author: T. J. VanEtten
Reviews.Content: I was not sure what to expect fully until I tried this product myself.  I am overwhelmed with gratitude.  This is an excellent Kindle Fire and it looks like I can do just about everything I do on the computer.  The quality of the pictures and text is fantastic.  I'm still learning how to use everything but this makes me want to jump up and down with glee even though I am 69 years young!
Reviews.Title: Lord, am I happy!!!

Reviews.Author: Ponnu
Reviews.Content: This is my second tablet. My first one was old generation IPAD (first release) and I just gave it to my wife and wanted to buy a cheaper one and ended up with this one. I am also a Prime member (that was one of the reasons to buy this device). To be honest, my old IPAD seems to perform better than this latest Kindle. I read a lot of PDF files, My IPAD beats this one down in that area. My old IPAD shows the first page of PDF file, if its a technical book, I know them by cover (first page). However in my kindle it all has same PDF icon and can not scroll more than few pages without seeing loading.. message.App availability- Initially I thought who wants all those unwanted Apps, but now after using for a week, I find there are nice apps which I regularly use are not availble for Kindle. I am not an Apple's fan,  but my next tablet probably be an IPAD. Wait..I do I still have this one. I am not saying its the worst tablet, its OK but not as good as an IPAD. And I need flash to watch my video
Reviews.Title: Nice hardware, but the UI and App availability terrible

Reviews.Author: Suzste
Reviews.Content: Much cheap cheaper than ipad. works as well as my friends ipad. I like the weight and size.  Love it
Reviews.Title: Very happy

Reviews.Author: Asiana
Reviews.Content: Perfect for the whole family specially the FreeTime function.  My 4-yr old loved it and don't want to play with his LeapPad anymore.  I can limit his game time, reading time,and video time without accessing my account.  The best part is I can limit the apps he can access and when he reached his time limit, it won't let him access them.The sound system is awesome, I played a couple of movies and the pictures are perfect.  So clear and vibrant and don't have to worry about battery life. Web browsing is not a problem, very fast.I actually bought one for my teenager as a Christmas gift. He has the original kindle fire and he's upgrading to the 8.9" HD.
Reviews.Title: Tablet for the whole Family

Reviews.Author: Nancy Sheehy
Reviews.Content: As a older Kindle owner.. I love the ebooks instead of paper bbooks for obvious reasons.. Preordered this one for my birthday present to me!  I ahve found very little to be disappointed from and so much to be so hapy about!  Not only can I read my books, but.. do so much more! I love the internet capabilities, the apps etc.. Did NOT like that I had to buy app for photos, cable for HDMI output and the regular plug in charger as I really think those items should be included.. However.. They do NOT detract from the fact That I LOVE THIS FIRE !  Really looking forward to some updates that may fix some little issues with some apps, but.. not tied to Apple chains and have all the great capabilities..  btw.. my free time has become so much fuller.. LOL
Reviews.Title: YES

Reviews.Author: Nancy A. Gregory
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HD.  I had an older version of Kindle Fire; and love this one so much more!
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Author: Becky Ogden "bpiggden"
Reviews.Content: My dad has purchased this for my mom for Christmas. He had it sent to my house so that I could have some apps loaded and it would be "straight out of the box" ready to go Christmas morning. How in the world do you get the broadband registered so that you can use it. I am beyond frustrated. He paid the $50 for a year of service and we can NOT get it to register. Can anyone help?? PLEASE!! I know Mom is going to LOVE it. Heck, I love playing with it. Luckily I have WIFI so that I CAN use it.
Reviews.Title: AT&T; Broadband

Reviews.Author: tony
Reviews.Content: Really a great tablet. I just received it and already enjoy it  much but ... the glare is very annoying. I have not yet found any environment were glare and reflection did not interfere with image on the screen.
Reviews.Title: glare problems

Reviews.Author: Angela Dino
Reviews.Content: Perfect for movies, books, surfing and shopping. I use Evernote to take notes easily with two thumbs. It's a great iPad substitute in my already overloaded back pack. My biggest gripe is that the Amazon Android store doesn't have all the apps that I use such as YouTube, Marvel Coming. I have to "side load" them from other stores. The other gripe I have is that pesky back button is too close to the delete key...I'm always pressing it accidentally when I try to correct my key entries.
Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect

Reviews.Author: Razan Abbass
Reviews.Content: Was surprised how much I liked it! Moved up from the old Kindle, and was worried about the brighter screen for reading, as I work on a computer for a living. Was thrilled to find that it doesn't bother my eyes at all! Am absolutely amazed at the quality for videos as well.
Reviews.Title: I love It

Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: I love my new kindle, I have the orginal, also love that,  But this was well worth the wait. The bigger screen is clear and crisp, great for watching movies and perfect  for reading books. not to big and not too small, its just right. The kindle does everything I need it to do and more.The only thing I would change , is to be able to personalize the lock screen.
Reviews.Title: kindle fire Hd 8'9"

Reviews.Author: glory
Reviews.Content: Just received the 4gb lte model and for price paid, amazon should have included the wall charger! kindle weighs less than my ipad and will be my new travel companion.
Reviews.Title: kindle 4g lte is a great product but for price, wall charger should have been included

Reviews.Author: Lori Jo
Reviews.Content: Loving this "new baby" - simple learning curve - my only other "device" is the Kindle 3 (keyboard reader) - I waited for this generation and pre-ordered - the only COMPLAINT I have is that U.P.S. delivered it to the wrong house and I had to go searching for it at 10:00 p.m. on the day it said "delivered" - it was delivered to the same house number as mine but on a completely different street in our neighborhood that was nowhere near me - the resident had it, she actually accepted the delivery earlier that day at 6:02 p.m., and then RELUCTANTLY handed it to me, I really feel like they were going to keep it, I was EXTREMELY UPSET.  This was obviously a U.P.S. mistake; but in addition, perhaps Amazon can stipulate "SIGNATURE REQUIRED" on expensive electronics with its shippers - I consider $100 and higher expensive, this item was $299.  Thank you!
Reviews.Title: GREAT!

Reviews.Author: Loki Ryan "Loki"
Reviews.Content: I thought my apps from the Old Fire would work the same on the new Fire HD.  But I was wrong. Here are some problems:1. Documents to Go. Nolonger plays powerpoint PPS slideshow automatically. They have to be manually advanced.2. OfficeSuite: Plays powerpoint PPS slideshow slowly. A 4-sec interval slide advances after 20-30 secs.3. CineXplayer, Es Explorer Player nolonger play MOV & M4V. I have to download Movie Player VISTA to handle these files.4. The Built in Personal Video Player plays m4v too jerky to be useful, even though the sound is good. I wish there was a way to select which files it manages, so I don't have to see them on start up.5. No APP to manage built in camera. You either buy one, or use ES Explorer to access the system's built-in camera app.6. No light to indicate that the Fire HD is charging, and when it is complete. Not sure if I should always leave it plugged in?One would think it was a problem with the apps, but when multiple apps have similar problems, then it just might be a Kindle Fire HD issue.Overall I love this new Kindle Fire HD, and I am happy that I upgraded. I just don't have an easy way to play my powerpoint slides shows automatically without converting them to an mp4 format. I can't find any app that works on the Fire HD.
Reviews.Title: Issues With New Fire HD

Reviews.Author: BBs Mama
Reviews.Content: OK, so I am not a tablet guru or anything, and I will admit that this is my first tablet.....but, after much research, I decided that the Kindle was for me.  I am pretty sure I have made the right decision.  It is ready to use right out of the box, just put your personal touches and you are ready to go.  It is very easy on my eyes, which was a concern for me.  The HD is wonderful! My whole family is addicted! I plan to buy one for my four-year-old for Christmas!
Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY KINDLE FIRE HD!!!

Reviews.Author: V. F. Taylor
Reviews.Content: My new Kindle is still charging but I was able to set it up before it was fully charged and was plugged in.  I love that it updated and set up with no effort on my part.  The screen and resolution is beautiful.  I know I will love this product.  I am a bit disappointed, though, that the camera is only front facing.  How are you supposed to take pictures of something else?  I would have liked a light that indicates that it is charging.  I was  having problems viewing some of the free videos that come with my Prime Membership.  The engineers worked on the problem and got it resolved.
Reviews.Title: Love it

Reviews.Author: petrakis konstantinos
Reviews.Content: The worst menu on tablets ever. No desktops - No widgets. I'm not against the amazon dependance of the device but I can't accept that I cannot have desktops and widgets and the play store as alternative for applications.
Reviews.Title: No desktops No widgets

Reviews.Author: Gina Ladner
Reviews.Content: I wanted to start by saying this tablet meets all of my needs.  Of course, I researched this tablet when it was announced as well as read reviews after its release. This is my 4th Kindle.  I have had my new Kindle Fire for about a month now, and it is definitely a keeper.  I will touch on a few issues below that have been mentioned in other reviews.THE CHARGER (or lack thereof):  I knew from research that it would come only with a USB cord for charging.  I have other chargers (one for the original Kindle Fire) but opted to purchase the PowerFast Charger for the ½ off price of $9.99 which is an option for everyone who purchases this tablet through Amazon.  The location of the charging port on the device does not bother me because I can just turn it upside down while charging and watch a movie easily without it being in the way.FLASH PLAYER:  I’m not going to say much about this except that there is a work-around for this by downloading an older version of Flash.  Read the comments on other reviews for details.DESIGN:  Fabulous is all I can say.  It is just the right size, not too small, not too big.  Thin and lightweight.  I purchased the Amazon Kindle Fire HD 8.9 case for $54.99.  It has a low profile and I like that.  I also have one of those AmazonBasics Netbook Bag for 7 to 10 inch tablets with a handle.  It carries my Kindle 8.9 (in the case I mentioned above), USB charger, and PowerFast Charger, whenever I am traveling.PICTURE QUALITY:  Fantastic, sharp, crystal clear movies and shows.  The high definition is really obvious when compared to my original Kindle Fire.  A++ in this area, Amazon!!WiFi:  I had no problems setting up WiFi.  After inputting my router security code, it recognized it and connected immediately.  I tested streaming a movie in the opposite side of the house where the signal is the lowest.  When streaming a movie on Netflix on my ORIGINAL Kindle Fire, it would sometimes lag and show a “buffering” message, but on the NEW Kindle Fire HD 8.9, there was NO lag or slowdown of streaming the same movie.  Movies and shows stream seamlessly and I have no connection issues, even low signal areas.SOUND QUALITY:  Dolby sound is very nice as well, however, 90% of the time, I use headphones.CAMERA:  For my use, the camera is a nice add-on, but I don’t intend to take pictures with this camera, anyway.  I have an iPhone for that and with this Kindle HD 8.9, it has the ability to import your photos from other mobile devices (iPhone?) and Facebook or Twitter directly to your tablet.  Love that feature!  I would primarily use this camera for Skype, probably.4G LTE WIRELESS:  This seems to be a bit issue with a lot of folks.  I’ll admit that I was attracted to the $49 one-time fee for a year’s worth of 250MB/month 4G LTE Wireless coverage.  But I knew that 250MB would not be enough for me.  We have 3 iPhones in our family through AT&T.;  So I went to the AT&T; store with my Kindle.  I dropped my current family plan and changed to a Mobile Share Plan which gave me 10 gigs of data per month for 3 iPhones and 1 Kindle Fire Tablet.  My hubby and son don’t use much data at all, and I use maybe 3 gigs per month.  So, in my world, this is a win-win and I’m spending only about $30.00 more every month for 10 gigs of data.  As you may recall, the other options given on the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 during 4G setup were 3 gigs for $30 a month and 5 gigs for $50 a month.  I’m getting 10 gigs for $30 a month.  Thank you AT&T;!!!PRICE DIFFERENCE:  OK, stay with me on this......I compared the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 32 gig for $369 and the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 4G LTE Wireless for $499.  This is a difference of $130.  So you pay $130 more for the same high end, 32 gig model just to include the 4G LTE capability.  THEN, the average person signs up for the $49.99 for the first year 4G LTE Wireless for 250MB of data per month.  So you are paying $179.99 MORE for this Kindle Fire HD 8.9 4G LTE Wireless just to get this feature.Now, when you look on AT&T;’s site, to get a data plan for a tablet equal to 250MG per month, it normally cost the average person $14.99 a month for this data plan.  This amount times 12 months equals $179.88.  So, really, AT&T;, is getting their money in the long run because Amazon is probably forking over most, if not all, of the profit they receive selling the 4G LTE version of the tablet to AT&T.;  Amazon probably views this as an acceptable loss because they know that they will recoup this amount plus more when people purchase media from their website.  Of course, this is only speculation on my part, but, it does sound feasible, doesn’t it?So, in my opinion, this tablet exceeds my expectations.  NO disappointments, NO frustrations, and NOT a waste of money, as many would claim in the 1 star reviews.  You just have to know what YOU need in a tablet, and know WHAT you are buying.  This is a media consumption device, pure and simple.  It’s not meant for heavy duty productivity, spread sheets, etc.  I LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Title: Amazon Hits A Home Run!!

Reviews.Author: C. Stowe
Reviews.Content: This is great and easy to use. I think it is faster and easier to use than the iPad. Love it
Reviews.Title: Better than iPad

Reviews.Author: Paul Cohen
Reviews.Content: This is primarily an Amazon consumption device.  For that, it is GREAT.  I hav several devices.  Nexus 7, Galaxy Note 10.1, iPad 4, iPad Mini.  I get them for my review blog and to play.  Each one has a uniqueness I like about them.I got the Kindle to be primarily my video, book, magazine, music player while at home.  I have a Roku and Cable, but sometimes I want to chill in bed and consume some media.  I dont care about e-mail or other apps as I plan on using this at home as a multi-media type device.The screen is awesome.  I will match it up with my iPad 4 on most things concernign video.  The sound quality is better than all but the Galaxy Note 10.1 which has 2 front facing speakers!!Reading books is awesome on this thing.  Magazines are even better.  Movie play is great in HD and I can easily have my eyes on the screen for an entire movie and not get strained.It is not the "do everything" tablet you might need.  If, however, your MAIN objective is to be tied into the Amazon system, then this is a device worth looking at.  The screen size is perfect.  It's a little heavy, but still not too bad.
Reviews.Title: Decent for what it's designed for

Reviews.Author: garriott
Reviews.Content: It's a great tablet. I got the 12 month $49.95 AT&T; 4G plan. Works great and simple to use. I love It!!!!
Reviews.Title: My new Kindle Fire

Reviews.Author: James B Cox
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what was advertised. The picture clarity exceeds expectations. I can not comment on the sound quality because of a hearing problem, but the volume is satisfactory.
Reviews.Title: HD in your hand

Reviews.Author: oktravelchick
